description:
There is an entire board of veggie options. Half cold, half hot. I really like the Tree Huggers Burger. They make the patty themselves too. The hot options take a little longer to make (made fresh) but well worth it.

This place can get pretty popular during the lunch rush, but the guy that runs it is so charismatic, it's a lovely experience every time. It's a local treasure.

Street seating only.
author: Jodie F.

description:
The food is just plain, nothing special.

The guy working here is very rude, he makes an unnecessary speech and then he's asking you what you want in a very rude way. I decided to give it a try cause I'm always around and I wanted to have something regular to eat, but I won't definitely come ever back again here. The service is always very important.
author: Isaac G.

description:
Went there today for lunch for the first time and got the pastrami sandwich and lets just say, it did not disappoint. Its probably the best pastrami sandwich I've had in the city. Owner said he guarantees I'll be back after I've had their pastrami sandwich. Says they've been doing pastrami for over 35 years.  Hate to admit it but he was right! I'd definitely go back.

Place is pretty small and they're doing construction over there so if you blink, you'll miss it.
author: L.T. F.

description: So stopped by here hungry after voting and doing my civic duty. I walked in and told the(now I know to be the owner) sandwich maker to make me whatever he recommends. He asked if I could be in the mood for chicken and I Said sure. He made me a delicious breaded spicy chicken sandwich with pepper jack cheese. The sandwiches are big so could only eat half and plan to have the other half for dinner! The bread pudding cake is bomb, don't skimp!
author: Julianne O.

description: The sandwich was really good.  The owner was a kick, and spent time joking around and playfully teasing me while he made my sandwich.  Nice guy. Good, big sandwich. Thumbs up.
author: M W.

description: Juan is a super nice guy. He told me his specialty was the pastrami and he was not kidding. I am not a fan of sandwiches but this was incredible,  I had to go back and give him a high five. My friend enjoyed the bacon avocado sandwich.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Excellent sandwiches!
Fresh bread baked on site daily.
Juan, the owner very friendly and personable.
author: Dennis V.

description: I've been coming here for the past 2 months on a regular basis during lunch time and it gets really busy but it's definitely worth the wait. Always the most friendliest customer service when I come.
author: Baljot S.

description: This sandwich joint has it all-- classic sandwiches, fresh ingredients, reasonable prices, friendly and kind customer service.  Juan will make you smile and the ladies that work there are also wonderful.  I have only had the tuna and it's really yummy.  Looking forward to trying some other items in the future.  If you're craving a sandwich or just looking to grab a bite in the neighborhood definitely check this spot out.  FYI it's a tiny place so be prepared to take your food to go.
author: Jessica I.

description:
Love this place! I went during lunch and it was quite busy. It took me about 25 minutes to get through the line but the wait was well worth it. Even though it's small, the owner truly livens it up with his infectious energy. You can really tell the regulars love him and even though the sanwiches are delicious, they keep coming back for him. 

I ordered the deluxe which was tons of turkey, bacon and avo. Quality bread, meat, and fully loaded made this large a** sandwich a hit. I heard alot of customers also raving about the pastrami. The veg options were a plenty and also looked good. They guy in front of me ordered some sort of fish sandwich that sounded pretty tastey too. 

Planning on making this little stop part of the weekly lunch routine.
author: Grace A.

description: Awesome. That pastrami is killer. I luv it and it was worth the travel from Oakland for that pastrami sandwich.
author: Oscar G.

description: This was seriously the best sandwich of my life. The bread is homemade daily. The meats and veggies were so fresh. And the owner was so friendly and happy. Such a wonderful sandwich shop. I'm sad I'm only visiting SF so I can't go everyday!!
author: Raina D.

description: My friend told me this was the best sandwich spot in the mission district and I didn't believe him until I had it! The owner is super friendly behind the counter. He gave me a sample of their sun-dried tomato mayo and it's life changing to say the least. I got the apple chicken sausage sandwich, but I'd also recommend their pastrami sandwich. Good vibes, great prices and amazing food and service.
author: Pnut B.

description: Most friendly owner I have ever met. The sandwich with avocado and ham was great. The bread was very fresh. I shall return again.
author: Jacky C.

description: My boyfriend and I stopped here because of the reviews we saw and everyone is so right! The sandwiches we got were delicious. Literally, best sandwiches we've ever had!! Juan and the girl that were helping us were super cool and funny. We'll definitely be stopping here more often!!
author: Gaby M.

description: Owner of store is super funny and approachable. Lots of variety for sandwiches and salad. I got the grilled chicken sandwich and it was delicious.
author: Annie C.

description:
Probably one of the best Sandwich establishments in San Francisco. This spot is something to write home about.

Definitely call ahead of time for sandwich pickup. 
I'm usually picking up for a breakfast sandwich which you can get in a small or big size. I go for egg with carmelized onions, bell pepper on Dutch crutch
Call ahead of time to get your sandwich then head to Dolores Park after.
author: Jodie L.

description:
this a good place to eat food, not the best but not the worst . most regular sandwiches are around $9.95. its fast to get attended . only thing i hate is that the man ( probably the owner he is hispanic with glasses) , he doesn't respect his female coworkers . he be cat calling them. he would not leave  me alone even when i left and sat outside to eat . He still came outside and get really close and ask personal info. Say that he is married but act like he didn't and hit on me and my mom and not leave us alone
NEVER GOING BACK !!!!.
author: Sara F.

description:
Just got the yummiest breakfast sandwich made and the owner is full of great energy 
Can't wait to come back try their sandwiches
author: Asmara V.

description: I went here the other day and got the Tuna melt in giant size. I normally don't eat sandwiches given that carbs are usually trying to ruin my life. But occasionally I do throw caution to the winds. I am glad I choose this spot for that wild abandonment. Their giant sizes are HUGE and delicious. They have a bunch of veggie options as well. They have one fish sandwich that I am very curious about, unfortunately they ran out of fish once I went. Tuna melt was awesome. The area is definitely a tiny bit sketchy. This is the place you go to grab your sandwiches before taking them over to Dolores Park.
author: Cynthia G.

description: Hot pastrami was really good, excellent service.  Kinda cramped though, small groups at best.
author: Roarke S.

description: This is my favorite sandwich shop in the city! Amazing customer service by family owned business- they truly care about their customers! Everything I've tried here has been delicious- I recommend the chicken parmesan! Yummmm! :)
author: Flor L.

description: Love this place! Great breakfast sandwiches, a short term parking spot out front, nice folks working there, nicer things in the shelves!  Check it out!
author: Kelli S.

description:
MOST LEGIT REVIEW: Okay so I don't go to Sammich Shops often, I'm not sure why but I don't. It doesn't really sound like the best thing to have or think of, but lemme tell you about this Sandwich Place. Oh my lawd, I walked in to I guess "Juan" the owner? Manager? Whatever the main guy, talking to his employees in Spanish about how they can do it, they got plenty of orders but they're gonna make them all and really trying with the team effort.

I walked in with 3 of my friends, one whose been there since she was like 10  and the rest were new like myself. Juan greets us telling us he'd make the best sandwich in the world and of course I was like nah, that's not true. So I ordered my Steak Milanesa sammich, and of course I didn't know what to expect cause you know it's just a sammich. 

I waited inside for like, 15 minutes or so for the sammich but I don't blame them for the wait. They had a lot of orders you know? So like that's okay with me cause they got a poppin business. Some customers are rude though, they are so impatient and I can see why the employees might get upset. If you go here please have a lil  patience cause it can be busy. Anyways they get my sammich done and I go outside and eat it. Lemme tell you this, I took one bite, and I felt my soul leave my body. Deadass, I fell in some kind of trance and I fell in love with this sammich. It was just soo poppin, it had lettuce, tomato, chipotle, cheese and all that meat. My lawd, it was just amazing. I plan to come every time I can when school comes again. Juan if you see this, you and your crew are amazing.
author: Manuel E.

description:
I bought the small deluxe sandwich for 10.25 ! Although it was good,

 it's overpriced! At least make it a meal deal for that price. Bread was fresh and all the ingredients were too.
author: Tino V.

description: I got a breakfast sandwich and a coffee and both were fresh and delicious. Little pricey, very small space, sometimes there's a line.
author: Morgan D.

description:
best Sandwich establishments in San Francisco. 
best there could ever be 
Lots of variety for sandwiches and salad. I got the grilled chicken sandwich and it was delicious.
Best i have eaten in a while
author: James M.

description: I lovvvveeeeee this place and Juan It's crazy your resistible funny loving personality brings you back for more of him and his delicious sandwiches sandwiches are always big impact labor they never skimp you on the meat . Are usually don't like tuna unless I make a homemade but they make some pretty awesome tuna although it doesn't have eggs in it still very good . They are pastrami is also Very delicious I come a couple times a week before work I will suggest calling ahead of time to plaice your Order.
author: Dejsha B.

description: Best sandwiches in East Bay/SF area. Their vegetarian sandwiches are full of flavor, and their meat options are also seasoned phenomenally. No complaints about anything: Home-made bread? Good veggies? Delicious meat? Heck yes!
author: Alana T.

description: We wanted to pick up a sandwich for lunch in Delores Park.  Found this shop almost right outside of the Bart Station and walked in.  Inside the shop it is small, fast paced, and filled with tasty smells.  The gentleman is very personable but the Sandwiches and the bread they bake stood out the most!  We are absolutely going back my wife had her bread toasted and was raving about it, next time...
author: Diego S.

description: This place rocks!  Their hot pastrami sandwich is the best I've had in San Francisco - the large size one is both lunch and dinner, so...great value!  The owner, Juan, is definitely a character!  When I'm down in that part of the Mission, The Sandwich Place is my go-to spot for a great sandwich....oh....and it's just as delicious every time!
author: Charlie L.

description: As soon as you walk in, you immediately feel welcomed by the friendly and funny staff of this family owned and operated small business. Multiple people from off the street stopped in just to say hello during our 10 minute wait for 4 hot sandwiches. Our first time here so they suggested the standing favorites of the joint, that have been popular for almost 40 years! (1st is pastrami & 2nd is chicken milanesa). The sandwich we had in question had a sundried tomato spread. Without even asking me, the owner, Juan, offered me a taste by cutting off the butt of a home made loaf of bread and spreading it generously with the flavored mayo. I was so surprised that he so willingly offered a free sample! The spread was tasty and the bread soft. Brother trusted the recommended pastrami sammie, Son got the BLT. I, on the other hand, reluctantly asked for a sample of the pastrami (since he had just given me a taste of the spread.) "Do you like mustard?" "Yes." Mayo?" "Yes." And Juan happily cut a nice slice off the loaf, finessed it with mustard and mayo, and loaded it with a heaping pile of pastrami. "Whoa! I just expected a small piece of meat but you gave me everything!" He said, "you can't taste it without all the other stuff!" Then jokingly said to my brother, "Watch- as soon as I give her this sample, she's gonna run out the door." I said, "No, as soon as I walk out the door I'm gonna give you 5 Stars on Yelp!".... So here you are- 5 stars for excellent customer service, funny and relatable stories about growing up in SF, and their delicious food!
author: Tiffany A.

description:
After 12 long years, I finally checked out the explicitly named Sandwich Place.  It was worth the wait.

I had the pastrami sandwich with all the trimmings (including jalapenos), and it was a generous and well-crafted sammy on a soft French roll.  Will have this one again.

The place is run by some sweet Latina ladies, very friendly and on top of everything.

Pro Tip: this is a tiny place and it's best to order your sandwich ahead and just pick it up, the place can hold maybe 3 people at a time max.
author: Saminda W.

description: Called to place a gigantic catering order and the guy was so rude. I asked if I should call back at a more convenient time and he literally said "you have 10 seconds before I hang up". - ok dude I'll bring my 600$ order to a better shop.
author: William K.

description:
Friday, 1:45 PM.

Quickie:
* Food quality
+ Service
- Hygiene
+ Menu variety

And then...?
The 'Deluxe" does not have quantity proportional to its cost. The Sandwich Place produces decent sammies though, even at high order volume.

**********
Constructive comments:
*Source ingredients
*Compost option
author: Chuck N.

description: As a visitor to SF, I loved this place. Delicious (and huge) pastrami sandwich. People mention the high prices, but I visited the Mission Bi-Rite Market the other day and prices for smaller (albeit more "gourmet") sandwiches are about the same. This is a family-owned business and you can feel the good vibes and sense of community. In my time in SF I'm happy to support this local place.
author: R C.

description: Way overrated. Nothing spectacular. I won't be returning as there was nothing tasteful about it. If I wouldn't have asked for thousand island the sandwich would not have been worth the hassle.
author: Petra M.

description:
Upon finishing a tour of UCSF medical school, some classmates and I were eager for a hearty, warm lunch. Since we came by way of (16th and Mission) BART, we decided to eat around there. We saw this sandwich shop's reviews and thought, "why not?" When we arrived at the quaint shop, Juan was sitting in front of this establishment. He immediately greeted us and said "you guys hungry? Come on in!" First impression of the inside was how small it was, BUT the selection of sandwiches on the BOARDS were GLORIOUS! Juan started to rattle off what kinds of sandwiches they offer from classics to vegetarian, hot to cold. We were so hungry everything sounded amazing. Then, he walked over to the meats and pulled a handful of steaming hot pastrami from its warm au jus! We were SOLD!! He mentioned that he makes his own bread every day, fresh cut meats and friendly service. Above all else, he made us feel like we've known him for years (we were in the shop for no more than 10 minutes). He genuinely cared about the customers and their needs. He even brought us more chairs so everyone can sit and enjoy their food! 

Sandwich time: I ordered the hot pastrami sandwich with everything (mayo, pickles, jalapenos, lettuce, tomatoes, pepperoncini, American cheese) except mustard. Total was less than $10. I was very impressed when I took my first bite. Everything was warm, crunchy, melty, and DELICIOUS! Bite after bite, I was more and more impressed. I would definitely go back again for more sandwiches and Juan!
author: Helen C.

description: It has the grittiness of mission street with the prices of Valencia. Sandwich was smaller and greasier than hipster places of similar pricing. It's quite expensive for a small greasy sandwich on Mission St. Friendly service, probably wouldn't come out of my way to get back here.
author: Victoria C.

description: The place to grab a great hot pastrami or tuna sandwich. One of the Mission and San Francisco finest sandwiches. I been going to this place for decades.Orders are to go
author: Juan V.

description:
The Sandwich Place should be a lunch staple for anyone in or near The Mission. 

Located on the seedy 2209 block of Mission across from the 16th Street BART, The Sandwich Place offers many selections for vegetarians and carnivores alike. From the over-the-top "Kitchen Sink" to the gluten-free, all veg "Tree Hugger," everything is awesome. 

Juicy and huge, the Ruben ($8.25), puts offerings from most Jewish delis to shame. While it is literally big enough for two people to share, it disappeared all too quickly in one sitting. The gooey Swiss cheese, nicely acidic sauerkraut, and creamy dressing meld with tender pastrami in the perfect combination. 

The owner, Juan, is friendly and entertaining. And all his bread, including the gluten free variety, is baked on site. 

An outlier among the myriad burrito joints, The Sandwich Place is heaven between two slices of bread.
author: CJ G.

description: One at least once a week and it is a treat. They have a great variety of options and I'll usually take one back to a co-worker. They are a hit in the office and everyone is jealous when they see me bring one to a friend
author: Michael P.

description: Very nice people! Local. They actually converse with you. You feel like you are at home in a way or a family member. Got a breakfast sandwich and chicken sandwich. They toast it as well. I also practiced my Spanish :).
author: V J.

description:
Love this place! The owner knows what he's doing and can handle a ton of orders at once.

For vegetarians, I highly recommend Sophie's Delight.
author: Sara S.

description: Very good sandwiches!  It's very similar to Quiznos actually.  I expected a lot of Pork and BBQ (not a lot of BBQ here, though the BBQ sandwich was excellent), but they have a little bit of everything actually
author: Fiona D.

description: It's fine, the sandwiches are pretty tasty. But for the 'deluxe' to set you back almost $10 I'd want 2-3 times as much turkey and a bit more bacon. It seems like a place you have to frequent in order to really get amazing service, and from what everyone else is saying, that's worth doing. But for a one off, it's not a fantastic experience. Four stars for supporting a local family business.
author: Andrea F.

description: SO DELICIOUS!! They have a wide variety of meat and vegetarian options. The guy who I believe owns it is super funny and friendly. You get a shit ton of food for your money.  awesome local business/hole in the wall in the mission. Boom.
author: Claire M.

description:
Craving A Sandwish? COME HERE! 

The Sandwishes Here Are NO J O K E!! 

Delicious, Yummy && Fullfilling!! Satisfied My Needs ! 

The Service Here Is Great, Love The Vibes! 

im Definatly Coming Back For MY Avocado Bacon Sandwish!
author: Cynthia S.

description:
This place is a great spot in the Mission, been here a few times for my lunch pick up. I must say, I'm blown away by the sandwiches. GREAT PRICE & The flavor is ON POINT. Everything tastes so FRESH! I absolutely LOVE their SAUCES too!! 

THEY ALSO USE GLUTEN FREE BREAD (Juan makes it himself)

Juan is also a great plus about this place. His CUSTOMER SERVICE is OUTSTANDING!!
The ladies that work there are also very sweet hard working ladies too.
I plan on coming back many times for lunch. I usually get papusas or a burrito, but those make me feel super lazy and guilty after i eat them. THIS IS A PERFECT HEALTHY LUNCH 

THANKS FOR EVERYTHING GUYS 
--Viola
author: China D.

description: Literally the best sandwich shop in the city! Try the sun dried tomato sauce on their homemade bread with homegrown veggies. You can't go wrong here. And the owner is an absolute sweetheart. Super energetic and makes you want to keep coming back just for the great conversation.
author: christen l.

description: I have been going here since i was a toddler! That's right i been craving it since then. I love my turkey sandwiches toasted with melted cheese. these sandwiches are the bomb and i would not trade it for any other place. Best spot in the San Francisco!
author: Priscilla P.

description: Basically full after just eating one half! Amazing staff that I would just want to come back to see them, but the delicious food is an added plus!!
author: Julia A.

description: The pastrami sandwich was life changing. The undisputed champion of Pastrami sandwiches. My shitty day at work was turned into a great day thanks to this sandwich. I'm about to get back in my car and drive back to this place to get one more.
author: Brandon M.

description:
I've been here 10+ times since I started working in SF this summer so it's about time to leave a review. THE SANDWICHES HERE ARE AMAZING. I seriously don't know where the reviews saying "oh the food here is average" are coming from--do you people not have tastebuds? Because allow me to iterate: this place is amazing.

I'm a pescatarian so I usually get the Veggie Veggie or the Kauai. Both are equally delicious. The regular size is enough to make me feel pretty full, but I've come here with friends who get the large and it's pretty gigantic. The owner is really funny and always great to talk to (though I occasionally catch him recycling his jokes, lol). Prices are super reasonable and while it's always lively around lunchtime the wait time is never too long (I'm usually in and out around 5 minutes, unlike some places *coughcoughYama*). 

Basically this is the perfect spot to get a sandwich and I will miss it dearly when I go back to Philly. You should totally come here for lunch!
author: Ava H.

description: Hands down the best sandwich in the Bay Area haven't been here since I was in middle school but I'm glad I stopped by and got me a sandwich soooooo good nice ppl please don't ever go away lol
author: Tammy B.

description: The Art of making a sandwich starts here. I will own up to eating the entire  kitchen sink. lol, I actually made a work decision based on how close it was to The SANDWICH PLACE. Everything under that bread is pure JOY. He is an artist and a good one the man has been a staple of the Mission District for over 40 years and it shows. Make a sandwich and feed the souls. Working woman and working mans full lunch. Awesome GOTO Lunch spot...
author: Lillian G.

description:
I don't get it. This must be one of those places that pays for a high Yelp listing, because both the coffee and sandwich were sub par. The bread wasn't even well toasted, and that pretty easy to get right. 

Three stars for the great service only, because the ladies who run it seem awesome, clearly have lots of regulars and were nothing but nice. But I just wanted some decent food to go. The avocado was perfect, so I ate that off the sandwich. The rest of it was not worth the wait.
author: Emilie W.

description:
Working in the mission this week and was craving a sandwich. I was so hungry I even thought about getting a Whopperito but found this great sandwich shop. Ordered The Deluxe and it reminded me of the sandwiches my mom used to get from the local place when I was growing up. 

Definitely will be back this week for their limited Prime Roast sandwich.
author: Tony C.

description:
Being new to the mission district I set out with a goal to try out new food everyday based on yelp reviews. 

Today I was in the mood for a sandwich and decided to take a walk down from 20th to this place. Let me start off by saying the area it was in isn't a place if visit when the sun is down or even when the sun is up. It's pretty close to the 16th at bart and is full of unique characters. Either way undecided to try this place. 

I went with a steak sandwich that was battered in some type of seasoning and grilled on a flat top. The meat came out tuff and and batter was barley there. The location is a little bit older and I was concerned about the cleanliness. The sandwich it's self was ok at best. Half way through I took out the meat and munched on the bread and chipotle sauce. I must say the bread is really good ( baked on site everyday according to the owner ). Overall I probably wouldn't visit this place again unless someone took me and pointed me in the right direction on which sandwich to get. 

Food -2
Location-1
Cleanliness-2
Saff-2
author: BayAreaFoodGuy Y.

description:
Looked this place up with my fiancé in the mission district. We were looking for a place with a vegetarian or a seafood option and this place had plenty of that. Juan is one of the owners and he was very quick to recommend a sandwich option that had a mango sauce, grilled bell pepper and onion with filet of sole.
The sandwich was called "The Kawai"
The staff was amazing and delightful. The food was great and the service was complimentary! I wanna go back anytime I'm in the area and would recommend it to everyone.
author: Antonio S.

description: This place deserves every single star. Great sandwiches, tons of variety, LOTS of vegetarian options, decent prices and the owner is a gem. He is proud of is work and loves what he is doing, gets along and has long relationships with all the locals, and he makes you feel welcome. I wouldn't change a thing. Thanks for all the great lunches
author: Joshua A.

description:
This place is amazing they have the best sandwiches 
They are super friendly  great place to go get a sandwich
author: Alejandra M.

description:
I loved my pastrami - they use warm pastrami which simmers in some delicious sauce before they layer it inside a soft, fresh baked roll. Toasted with gooey slices of swiss cheese? Yes, please!

The specialty sandwich combinations were interesting, alot of them contained balsamic (not quite my cup of tea), and I don't think they're quite as innovative as the combo's that Ike's or Sandwich Spot has designed, but their sandwiches taste better! It's not especially cheap for the quantity that you get; ~$8 after tax for a small-ish "regular" sandwich, but then again it's probably a good thing they portion control for me heh. They take credit cards, no minimum!

I highly recommend this sandwich place, be sure you ask for garlic mayo and/or spicy mustard... mMm.
author: Jess C.

description: chicky chicky part part was pretty great!
author: Shawn K.

description: A few days after reading SFist's "the 30 best sandwiches in San Francisco (http://sfist.com/2014/12/04/the_30_best_sandwiches_in_san_franc.php)," I found myself here.  Let's just say the stars aligned.  This place looks very unassuming from the outside.  Once you enter you are warmly greeted by the owner's son Juan, and other members of the family.  The sandwiches are large, made the way you want them and oh so good.  I was here at 7a and another day at 2p and both times, the parade f customers never stopped.  A definite add for your 'to try" list.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Excellent sandwich place in the heart of the mission.  The chicken parmesan sandwich is excellent!  Very tiny place, no indoor seating,  but there are a couple tables outside.  Juan is very friendly and personable,  and he clearly loves what he does.  Highly recommended when you're in the city and need a great sandwich for reasonable $$.
author: Marty C.

description:
The Sandwich Place is a tiny little sandwich place tucked away somewhere near the 16th St BART station. It's difficult to find since it blends in with the other generic shops around it - but once you've found it, your taste buds will guide you straight back for more!

I had their Hot Pastrami Sandwich and my goodness was it delicious. I can see why they have 4.5 stars! It was pretty greasy - but hey, I did order a pastrami sandwich so what else could I have expected? The sandwich was also HUGE - enough for 2 meals. 

It's difficult to get the timing right for the hours, too, since they're pretty much only open for lunch from Mondays to Saturdays.
author: Don L.

description: As a Bay Area sandwich lover, I was in the area and wanted to try The Sandwich Place that I had heard about it. It lived up to its expectations. Great, juicy hot pastrami sandwich on a heated roll with everything and hot peppers (my only thing is I'd probably ask for a little less mayo). The giant size was maybe a tad too large for me so I may consider the regular size next time around. Service was quick and very friendly. Maybe I'd try some of their special combos next time, but MMM, that hot pastrami was so good!
author: Rick T.

description:
THE MENU IS HERE!
http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurants/the-sandwich-place/menu

A recent REVIEW on SFgate is here:
http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2012/04/12/NSVT1NE9UL.DTL
author: Amy W.

description: I love this place. All their sandwiches are made with their fresh daily baked bread. As soon as you walk thru the door Juan makes you feel at home he greets you with a warm welcome. These family style sandwiches are made with lots of love. Best sandwich place in the mission!!!
author: Dapper D.

description: My fiancée and I were greeted like family the moment we walked in. We were looking for some vegetarian options and we're excited to see the many options. Lucky for us there special happened to be a delicious fish fillet sandwich. It's the kind of place you look forward to visiting time and time again. We left and returned later that same day for a coffee. I was happy to see the care that went into preparing even just a regular coffee! The food and coffee are yummy, but the love and care put into it are what make this 35 year old, family-owned business a unique treasure.
author: Rocio G.

description: The Sandwich Place is as simple and solid as the name. You walk in, order your sandwich, receive it quickly, then proceed to enjoying it. The place may be a little small on the inside but honestly what more do you need from a sandwich shop. The selection is plentiful and well organized, very easy to find the right sandwich as soon as possible. The service is speedy and all the employees are very affable, they can help pass the short amount of time waiting with some light banter. Absolutely no time is wasted in this place, besides enjoying the sandwich. I had the honey chicken sandwich and it was truly a top tier bite. The honey added a delicate tang to the savory taste packing a punch to the sandwich as a whole. It was grilled to perfection as well, the bread had the slightest crisp on the exterior while still being soft and warm on the inside. But what really stood out to me was how well the sandwich held itself together. It was snugly packed and stayed together until the last bite. If it's one thing I don't like it's a loose sandwich and this was the tightest sandwich I've ever sunk my teeth into. This makes the podium when it comes to sandwich shops.
author: Qasim S.

description:
Hot pastrami sandwich all the way! Hole-in-the-wall run by Juan, an interesting guy and a good business man. I'll mainly be back to try some of their other hot sandwiches for sure. 

They were all super nice to me as I waited for my sandwich. They also almost gave me the wrong sandwich (I almost walked out with it,) but they fixed their mistake quickly. There is always drama and talking going on in the back of the store it seems, but I just tune it out for a good sandwich. 

A small gripe is that I wish their bread had more substance to hold the meat/cheese/etc. The sandwich kinda collapsed on me by the end of the meal. But meat quality was top-notch. And the spiciness was awesome too. 

I'll definitely be back, a lot!
author: Sneha P.

description: Family run place. The owner has his granny or great aunt or whoever running the cash register. The young gal who works there rolls her eyes at the bossman every time he says anything to her, and I get it. She's young and cool and is OVER IT! He is kind of a bossy-know-it-all. Above all this place just feels good. Like my family. We fucking hate/love each other. They work together and make some seriously great sandwiches. I love the banter, and I love how close it is to my house. Just a perfect dog walk away. Be careful not to miss it, it's kind of hidden between the McDonalds and the weird clothing bargain store. Great fresh home made bread too!
author: Vanessa B.

description: I've been a customer since 1988. I moved to the North Bay 15 yrs. ago and there's no place like it ! Whenever I go to the city,I have to have my shrimp sandwich ! JUAN knows his stuff!
author: Mi B.

description:
A sandwich place in burritoland & Juan holds it down!

Every sandwich I or coworkers & friends have gotten, has been to die for.

Go for the sandwiches, but stay for entertainment. Juan is a bilingual phenom that just makes your day better. I love getting "stuck" picking up the group order for lunch here, because Juan turns a short wait into the best part of my day.

I almost always order the chicken milanessa, which I first tried because of Tommy P's review.

They also have breakfast, a GREAT Bacon & Egg sandwich right at 16th & Mission!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Have only had two of the sandwiches from here but they were pretty amazing. 

The Sophies choice was super good .. the mushrooms on it were absolutely delish. 
The guy that runs it (Juan) is one of the nicest people ever. 

Entertaining and friendly. 

Great prices and located right across from the 16th street bart. Give it a try and you'll see why :)

Side note... he bakes his own fresh Gluten free bread. Call ahead to make sure they have some left.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Let's see what I remember:
- Hole-in-the-wall.  
- Real, energetic guy who runs the place.  Seems very passionate
- Great sandwiches ... the large turkey is a great deal that you'll probably have to split over two meals.
author: F. P.

description: I've ordered sandwiches from this spot multiple times and they've always been fantastic. Great service and a very friendly atmosphere. I love the simplicity of the basic sandwiches. Bread, mayo, mustard, onions, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles and jalapeños. It's exactly what I'm looking for when I want a solid turkey sandwich.
author: Charlene S.

description:
The Sandwich Place is a small restaurant on Mission by 16th. They use the Square on their iPad so they accept credit cards. Yay! Which is wonderful because I seriously hate carrying cash in the Mission.

The menu is huge, and I didn't have time to read enough review to make a good decision. I read "pastrami is good" so I ordered the Regular sized Hot Pastrami since the line moved fairly quickly and I needed to make a decision.

This sammie was delicious. My favorite thing was the homemade gluten-free bread. They don't offer different choices for bread, I think because they use the same type for every sandwich. It is a little sweet, and a little savory, but it is light, delicious and toasted lightly so that it doesn't cut up your mouth.

The pastrami itself was pretty okay. It could have used a little more taste, but I ordered it with everything, and jalapenos so it helped to add a little pizzazz. The pastrami was not too fatty, which is great.

Outdoor seating is available, but the wonderful smells and sights of the Mission usually make me lose my appetite. 

Next time, I will order the Ruben.
author: Rosie M.

description: Juan is an entertaining manager that loves to work face to face with the customer. The staff is great, sandwiches are great. definitely worth your time.
author: Tyler M.

description: Fresh, delicious sandwiches! Great prices too. The employees are very polite and friendly. One even gave soup to a homeless man outside. Perfect lunch!
author: Davis F.

description:
Today we went to this place: "The Sandwich Place" in San Francisco and they charge us through Square. The amount was $22.25 and we paid it with our debit card. But before the end of the transaction they touch a button without showing us what it was and then we signed and I always, send all the receipts to our email, so I did it.

But when I checked the email, there's an amount that we didn't agree to pay... it's $1.95 and its called "S000", we don't know what it is and what it means.
In other places, for tips, they asked you to put the amount that you want using Square too.

I want to complain about this business and also about the strange practices they do using Square.

The sandwiches were meh, they use a LOOOT of mayonnaise.
author: Chio B.

description:
It took two tries to find a day when Gluten Free bread was available, but Juan stuck to his word when he said they'd have some the next day. I've done my fair share of gluten free baking, and it's hard. Bread is seemingly impossible so I have to give Juan props for getting his bread so close to normal bread in texture. But there was something in it that gave it a pretty bitter taste and made my gums and tongue itch and my throat had some swelling. I do have a buckwheat allergy, but Juan promised that he doesn't use buckwheat so, I'm kind of at a loss and super bummed that I can't get a GF sandwich here, because this is clearly an amazing place! 

My husband had a normal sandwich and his review was that it was the best sandwich he's ever had. And we have had a lot of sandwiches!
author: Heidi S.

description: Good place to get a sandwich. Had the pastrami was good and not dry.  I guess with all the yelp stars drove me to this place I was expecting more. The people were super friendly.
author: Nick M.

description: They get five stars for their customer service But that's Where it ends.  I haven't stop at this place in forever,  so I decided to get some breakfast a chorizo and egg sandwich bad idea! I only ate half because I had a bad feeling and gave the other one to my friends co worker. To make my long story short i got food poising really bad actually and then days later I found out my friends co worker got also food poising. I will never stop here again. BEWARE!!!
author: Julia D.

description: I use to live in the city and came here years ago but when I moved  away, this is one of the places that I truly missed. Since I just started to work in the neighborhood I just had to stop by and  may I say. I really missed this place, from the  whole made bread to the Roast Beef which is cooked in house, this little  hole in the wall is great. If your ever in the city you should defiantly  stop  by an try the " AL PACINO " you won't be disappointed.
author: Angela S.

description: Great sandwiches and even better customer service! Better than Ted's Market & Delicatessen in my opinion.
author: Claudia G.

description: Closed at 12:55pm on a Friday. The one time I try and eat someplace other than Pancho Villa for lunch. Booooooooooo
author: Heather C.

description:
WOW! Just when I thought I have had the best sandwich in the city a place like The Sandwich spot comes along and kills it! 

I found this place on a whim when walking thru the Mission today and it did not disappoint. I got the special, and amazing baked chicken sandwich with fresh greens and a balsamic dressing and cranberry mayo.....yeah cranberry mayo, who knew?! 

The sandwich was almost as good as the service! Juan was a gem and even gave me a quick spanish lesson on how to ask for a straw. You cant beat it! 

I am looking forward to my next visit already!
author: Alicia K.

description: Its a good value, lots for an economical price. I got a vegetarian like sandwich and I enjoyed it. They do soups too but it wasn't as good as the sandwiches. I prefer their non meat sandwiches because like most places, the meat isn't high quality. It will fill you up though.
author: Brian P.

description:
Waiting for your sandwich is like watching stand-up - the owner loves his work and his customers, and it shows. 
Oh, and spectacular sandwiches!
author: Rishad P.

description:
I went here at 11:45am for lunch with a friend. We wanted to beat the lunch crowd.

First, the ambiance. They only have seating outside on the sidewalk. Inside, there's just enough room for a 4 person line in front of the counter. The Mexican ladies are very nice and easy to understand.

I ordered the Chicken Sandwich sans pickles. My friend ordered the Pastrami con muchos jalapeños. I really liked the bread -- it was very soft. My friend didn't think it was anything special.

My friend really enjoyed his sandwich. He appreciated that it was piled high with fresh California veggies. Especially the diced jalapeños, which added a surprising kick. The tomatoes were super fresh and sweet too. And very red.

I was very satisfied with my sandwich. The bread and chicken were warm and savory, and veggies were generously portioned and cool.

Neither of us would say we were blown away, though.

They had a decent selection of drinks and potato chips (my friend went with his favorite - cracked pepper and sea salt). Two cans of diet coke rounded out the meal.

I'd go again. If there was a line, it would have been uncomfortably slow.
author: Max H.

description: Been coming here since I was seven -- I'm now thirty! The shop's still owned by the same family and has been passed down from mother to son. Absolutely the best hot pastrami sandwiches in the Mission (who would have thought that Nicaraguan gentiles could turn out a mean pastrami on rye)! One of the last remaining gems in the Mission, it's been around for a looooooong time, and I hope it stays up and running forever! Please, please, PLEASE support this place!
author: Evie O.

description:
Holy wow, this place is amazing. When I was paying for my sandwich (Sophie's Delight), Juan (the owner, I presume) mentioned that after tasting his sandwiches, I would remember him. He wasn't kidding! I was in the Mission for work and was entirely too hungry to wait to get home to eat. I Yelped nearby spots and found the Sandwich Place nearby. It was highly rated and the price was too awesome to not try. Well, fellow Yelpers, you didn't lead me astray! If I lived closer, this would be a weekly addiction for me. Their selection of vegetarian sandwiches is exceptional -- they have a wall with 10 - 12 varieties that all look incredible -- and they have tons of options for meat-eaters, too.

Juan mentioned that he bakes all the bread in house, makes the sun dried tomato mayo himself and he clearly takes pride in his work (I love that)! There's not a lot of room to sit and eat, but if you're looking for a bite to go, give this place a whirl.
author: Shannon E.

description: Good place. Basic sandwich shop no bells and whistles but me and my boyfriend split the large sandwich and were satisfied!!! Super friendly service and attentive which is awesome because I am very picky!! Only thing is I wish they had more topping choices. I
author: Jenise K.

description: Owned by really sweet ladies. I ordered a veggie sandwich and it was really good for the price in the city. The bread seemed fresh and chewy. Just how I like it. All the vegetables and ingredients seemed fresh also. Its a couple blocks away from my work so I'm really happy i found this hole in the wall.
author: Tiffany C.

description: I'm always greeted with a smile when I come in here and the chicken Milanesa is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had.  It might take a little longer than you'd expect, but still worth checking out!
author: Ann Z.

description:
Best Sandwich shop on the mission. I always get my sandwich made by the younger woman who usually is in the front, she makes by far one of the best sanwiches ive ever tried. I come in often through out the week on my lunch break and my food is on point every time. 

*Also try the clam chowder on fridays!! Awesome!! :)
author: Tha C.

description: I've been going there to Juan's Sandwich place since I use to go highschool. His mom was  n still is a sweet heart. I remember goung to buy my sandwich every morning but I had to make sure it was before school time. Otherwise she wouldn't make us one, because we would be late to school. Now that I move across to the east bay I still love going there. Best sandwiches and the family love u get from them. My daughter goes crazy if I dont bring her one, she will text me sereval times to remind me not to for get her sandwich.  To me thats my #1 sandwich spot in the mission. Try them u wouldn't regret it.
author: Rosa M.

description: I stopped in today because it smelled so good!  I walked in and was immediately greeted by Juan, and asked him what he recommended. He said hands down, the pastrami. I usually eat veggie because that's my preference, but I decided to go ahead and try my very first pastrami sandwich. The home made bread was toasted to perfection and the provolone cheese complimented the meat very well. It was so yummy!  I can't wait to go back and try some of the other sandwiches!  Thanks Juan!
author: Aronel T.

description:
Gluten Free and Picky here writing another review. 

Recently, i went to Ikes for a Gf sandwich and after waiting in line, was informed that they were out of GF bread. Imagine my sadness as my heart was set on 2 pieces of GF bread with pastrami in between. Naturally, I yelped to see if there was another sandwich shop and this place popped up. I quickly drove to the mission, parked, and hopped on in. I promised the owner I would write a review, like it or not so here it goes...

First, he makes his own GF bread and it was good. Admittedly I didn't LOVE the bread but it was very good. It was a little crumbly which always makes sandwiches tougher to eat, and I ended up using a knife and fork on it. 

So why the 5 stars you ask...? 
Well, I got the hot pastrami and it was AMAZING! It was flavorful, fresh, and absolutely perfectly piled high atop the bread. The cheese was a pepper jack and was an excellent combination with the pastrami. The sauce he makes is savory and added flavor without being overdone. Add peppers, lettuce, and tomato and the sandwich stood about 3-1/2 - 4 inches tall from bottom to top!

Finally, the price...a giant sandwich plus chips and out the door I was under $11! 

I have got to say that Ike's has some competition!
author: Min M.

description:
The sign on the door read "gluten free bread baked fresh daily" and I was sold!

The owner is really nice, very friendly and welcoming, and told me all about his mission to make the best gluten free bread possible.  I love it.  They put all kinds of tasty, fresh ingredients on there and its really affordable.  Amazing find for that neighborhood.  Especially since its hard to find a good gluten free sandwich place that won't empty my wallet.

FYI, no seating in here, its a tiny hallway of a deli.
author: Katie S.

description:
Second visit.  Even better than the first.  Jackpot!

The Special of the Day: The Californian was freak'n awesome.

Also, my husband's chicken apple sausage sandwich was out of this world.

Dang, I didn't think we could have a competitor to Ike's, but this is a close race.  I'm totally the winner here getting all the goods from both.
author: Alexis B.

description: This place has the best vegetarian sandwiches I've ever had! I moved back to Brooklyn a couple years ago and I still think about this place. I would highly recommend the tree hugger and the southwestern for vegetarians and non-veggies alike. Every time I go back to visit San Francisco I have to stop by the sandwich place. Just wish they had extended hours on weekends!
author: Carey B.

description:
Highlights:
Super friendly owner
Super soft and chewy fresh bread.

Loaded breakfast sandwich and a large coffee will run you about $8.00
author: J L.

description: Delicious sandwiches and the women who run this place are darling. I want adopt them as mothers/grandmothers.
author: Emily P.

description: Just a damn good chili cheese dog. Nice people, menu is simple and in big letters. Definitely coming back for one of their sandwiches.
author: Tony P.

description:
Had the Sophie's Choice and it was wonderful

Juan, the owner, introduced himself and we had a really nice conversation while sandwich was being made.
author: Foodlover B.

description: The pastrami is amaze balls, regular size is good enough for 2 meals. Recently I've had to go on a gluten free diet, so I had to rule this place out as a possible lunch backup, until I remembered reading Juan baked his own gluten free bread. When I walked in a month later (no hard feelings), Juan said he doesn't bake that bread too often anymore. Considering he knew I was a regular, he offered to bake a gluten free loaf just for me, and to give him an early heads up next time so he can try to plan to make sure I have the option. I love this man, 5 stars for making such a wonderful accommodation, I may never leave his place now!
author: Katie L.

description: Always awesome service . Great sandwiches at reasonable price . Check out their weekly specials . ESP . The Al Pacino
author: Carlos Q.

description: Juan is the best, and he makes great sandwiches too! Always friendly. He also has plenty of vegetarian options, and great homemade soups. Juan also cares a lot about the surrounding community. Oh, and did I mention that he makes great sandwiches? :)
author: V. C.

description: They make the best pastrami sandwich I've ever had.  I eat a lot of pastrami sandwiches, but this place is my favorite.  They perfected the sandwich craft, just the right amount of thinly sliced onions, peppers, pastrami, bread, mayo.  The ratio of everything relative to each other is perfect.  Most highly rated sandwich places over do the flavoring, after a few bites it's just not as good.  But, this place, the 1st bite is as good as the last.
author: Gilbert C.

description:
I'm not hung over today but wanted a hangover breakfast. Off to Mission. You know how it is. Wander a bit looking for somewhere promising, check Yelp a bit, not feeling it, start heading back up to 16... and then the planets aligned. I've been tourist-trolling this area for a decade and 16/Mission BART is always my first stop when I arrive on a plane. How in the hell have I managed to miss The Sandwich Place? Answer: truly a hole-in-the-wall. They've been around almost as long as I've been alive and have got this Sandwich Thing down to an art. For me, go big or go home unrepentant gluten-omnivore style: Giant Kitchen Sink with everything. They bake their own bread and the roll was amazing: that perfect light crispiness outside and just the right amount of soft, glutenous chewiness inside. The pile of meat and cheese was an inch and a half thick and the overall sandwich looked like it could fit at least four Subways. Very "me." Taste was as it should be: fresh. The kicker? I couldn't have made this sandwich at home for less money. 

My only regret is not having had a hangover, because eating this beast in this place in that condition would have been the only way to make it better. Maybe I need to come back for lunch.

Finally, Juan is an absolute trip. I was in just after open and we sat outside, me munching while he told me stories in between greeting by name gaggles of the morning passersby. Try to catch him when it's light, he's an Experience.

Eat here.
author: Tom C.

description: This place rocks! the first sandwich I had was the "Bad boy" and it was pretty solid. I have had various other sandwiches since then, and you really can't go wrong with anything. You can get a regular or lrg sandwich; the lrg is a gut buster so if you go that direction, don't expect to be able to do any more work for the rest of the day. The food great, but what really makes this place stand out is the service. The man that owns this place has owned it for years (20+ I believe) and is a real character. Its rare to find a place where the owner is taking the orders and genuinely cares about the product he is providing. Oh yeah, had the breakfast sandwich today with bacon, eggs, jalapenos, tomatoes, and swiss cheese, so good!!!
author: Eucalyptus J.

description: The owner knows his way around a sandwich and has a way with people. He is funny, engaging, and he knows that he is good at what he does. The portions are huge. The sandwich was stellar. The prices are a tad on the high side, but you could tell that it's because you're eating some quality food in the ghetto. The seating options are basically non-existent and if you manage to score on one of the two outdoor tables, you are guaranteed to find some random people causing a huuuuuge scene with some yelling matches. If it wasn't so terrifying, it might be entertaining.
author: Rebecca A.

description:
Another gluten free sandwich option! And an excellent one, at that! 

I was swanning around the Mission with a sandwich craving, the size of Texas. A quick search revealed this place and after reading that they bake their own gluten free bread, daily, I went straight to it. I ordered the Sophie's Delight. Yum! It's vegetarian (I'm not, but it sounded so good) and brimming with flavor. It was so good, that I wanted another one, as soon as the last but of crust was gone--even though I was completely full. 

The very gregarious owner called Juan, gave me a brief history of the shop and how he came to perfect his own loaves of gluten free bread. When he handed me my hot and savory sandwich, he said that I had to eat it right away, as most GF breads go limp quickly. I had a good 5 blocks to walk, and several flights of stairs to climb before I could devour my goods, and despite the fact that the bread was almost too-soft, the buttery flavor, and crisp edges made it not matter one lick. It was hands-down, the best GF bread I've tasted, since becoming GF two years ago.
author: Tricia B.

description: Absolutely love this place. At least once a week I get a Kitchen Sink giant size my favorite sandwich in the city.
author: Javier G.

description:
I dare you to find a better pastrami sandwich in the Bay Area

I'm from the Northeast, and I have struggled endlessly to find good hot pastrami.  Out here, everyone has like this lame lean-cut meat.  Pastrami is supposed to be fatty!!!  Thats where all the 'effin flavor comes from.

(+) Hot Pastrami + toasted light rye + pickles + onions + spicy deli mustard = My perfect pastrami sandwich

(+) The prices are fairly cheap

(-) None, but I rarely try other sandwiches

THE BOTTOM LINE:

(+) The 5 star rating is just for the pastrami, but the other sandwiches are good too.
author: Matthew S.

description:
SO many vegetarian options. I can't tell you very much about any of them besides the Veggie Veggie, though, because it is so good that I have vowed never to eat another type of sandwich ever again. I'm doing an internship near here, and there are so many good restaurants nearby that I want to try, but I find myself just going back to The Sandwich Place.

Unfortunately, every trip involves listening to the owner berate his employees in Spanish. I'm (somewhat) sure it's all in good fun, but as a customer, I find it super unpleasant to listen to.
author: Lauren O.

description: Daughter had a plain turkey, husband had a turkey avocado, and I had a crab sandwich. I didn't care for mine ( not real crab and it was basically imitation crab and loads of mayo ) my husband said his was delicious though and their service was efficient and friendly.
author: Madhuri K.

description: This place is awesome, and the perfect example of why you should support/try local establishments. The owner is hilarious, the sandwiches are delicious, and I can't wait to go back.
author: Eliza D.

description:
Really amazing sandwiches, and the bread is perfect. You can really tell that they bake it themselves and really care about the quality of their product rather than just making money.

That being said, prices are a bit higher than Subway/Quizno's/Togo's, but I think the better food is still worth it. I wish they stayed open a lot later, though. It seems that these nice sandwich shops always close early and end up just being lunch places rather than dinner. I guess not everyone wants a sandwich for dinner, but I'm happy with it myself.


The closing time, from what I can tell is 5 PM on weekdays, 2Pm on Saturdays, and they stay closed on Sundays. While I prefer places open on Sunday, it's nice to see that they care for their employees and give them Sundays off. I understand that having Sunday off is important for a lot of people.

I got a basic turkey sandwich, had it warm, "giant size" with everything except mayo. They put a lot more mustard on than most places, but it really just made the sandwich even better.

This is a place to go to for great food.
author: Jesse R.

description:
Amazing food. Not just sandwiches, but home made desserts and hot dogs too. 

The owner is so friendly and welcoming. He really makes this place something special.
author: Jason L.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE the food, Juan is so friendly and energetic and kept me laughing since the minute i stepped foot in that door! lol Great food and love the energy
author: Vi P.

description: this hidden gem has a ton of sandwich options, including excellent gluten-free bread. wonderful people too, they take good care of you!
author: Marc H.

description: The guy behind the counter was great, efficient and engaging. The sandwich was good size and pretty delicious. My one issue was that the chicken was a little dry, so it threw off how great the sandwich could have been.
author: Evan H.

description: Warm and friendly mom-and-pop type shop. I ordered a giant pastrami sandwich and it was large and delightful. Looking forward to another sandwich the next time I go to the Mission.
author: Alfonzo J.

description: I was hankering for a stacked veggie sandwich and set out to find it in the Mission. The objective was to find gluten free bread. From the reviews I decided on The Sandwich place. The place was crammed and tiny but clean and bright and just fine for a pick up. I opened my sandwich and was in veggie heaven. So yummy and good. I just wish the slices were bigger. I nommed the hell out of that sandwich. Cant remember if I ordered a side of avocado or it came with, but I remembered getting a good amount and it being damn good. I as very pleased to find that the owner who also happened to be working bakes his gluten free bread daily. He told us his story on the evolution of The Sandwich place and that he works there almost every day. Keep up the good work Juan!
author: Cassandra M.

description:
This place is a hidden gem. Well it's not exactly hidden, but I wouldn't have gone here if I hadn't needed precisely a huge sandwich to soak up the alcohol from the night before, and searched for good reviews in the land of the burrito (where I had crashed for the night.). I've probably passed by it a dozen times and assumed it was a Western Union of some sort. The spot is very unassuming from the outside.

But the inside--how cute!  Small and colorful, with long lists of creative sandwich creations covering the walls. My friend and I both chose veggie deals--one with avocado and the works, the other a garden burger with the works, and both with pesto & sun dried tomato mayo. (Mayo must be healthy if it's colored with veggies, right?)  Lots of fun vegetables like peppers and mushrooms stuffed inside a hard sourdough and a soft fluffy roll.They were huge and hearty, for a very decent price--I'm completely stuffed now and I have some dollars still left in the old wallet.

All of the ladies working there were really nice. The abuela cashier made me laugh. I will definitely be coming back here and trying the Spanish and Italian style meat options. Oh yeah, cash only.
author: Acacia Q.

description:
+  Egg, Bacon, Cheese Sandwich - Melty cheese, eggs made to order, crispy bacon.  The epitome of a simple delicious breakfast sandwich.

+  Chicken and Shrimp Salad Sandwiches - Both made fresh with veggies and their totally delicious home made bread.

+  The Deluxe - turkey, bacon, fresh avo, jack cheese.  The girl making the sandwiches is awesome.  She seems to know exactly what she's doing, and does it very well.

+  Steak Sandwich - steak and delicious toppings.  These sammies are all so so so tasty.

I've had a few others, everything is rock solid delicious, IMHO.

They have everything else you could want spanning the sandwich spectrum, salads, soups, drinks, lots of good stuff.  They have a dedicated vegetarian menu on their left wall as you walk in, it's pretty neat.

This is a totally family run joint.  It's old school, and I totally love them for that.  There is an older boy who has come up and worked their "register", I think that's really neat, and so rare anymore nowadays.  Values aside, the most important part is I think they have amazing sandwiches.

Only downside I can think of is there is no seating inside, only one table outside, and the location isn't the most convenient for a close picnic spot (Dolores Park I guess), so plan ahead in that regard.

Their "register" is an iPad, good for them for getting in early on that trend.  And they do now use FourSquare to accept credit cards, charging us the 1.8% or whatever fee they get charged by the merchant (as they should).  Tip these guys, they deserve it.

By the way, I was talking to the owner, Juan, and I said, "People love you guys on Yelp," and he responded instantly by pulling his phone out of his pocket, logging onto Yelp, and looking up his restaurant.  That's a great owner.  He sort of scratched his neck and says, "Yeah thank you for saying that, some people don't always like us," or something like that.  This was back in early July 2012 after 2 of the most recent reviews had been 3 stars.  So I don't know if that's what he was referring to but it was totally clear that he cared and was reading the things that people were saying about his business on Yelp, and that is a part of what Yelp is all about, so for that show them some love...

Thank you guys so much for being such a truly perfect sandwich shop in the middle of The Mission, go figure.  Machas gracias, mi amigos.  I will return again and again.

http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurants/the-sandwich-place/menu
author: Jon P.

description:
I stopped by this sandwich shop during a trip to a studio in the SOMA area, and it was the best choice I had made all day. 

This place is stowed away in the middle of some ghetto looking shops (next to a McDonalds and across the street from the 16th & Mission Street BART Station). From the outside it doesn't look like much, but once you step in, the aromas alone will make your mouth water. 

There are a variety of sandwiches, but like Juan says--the hot pastrami is what made the shop famous over thirty years ago. But there are so many good sandwiches here! I definitely, definitely would recommend this place to anyone. 

Juan is also a great guy to talk to. He's an alumnus of UC Berkeley. If it's not a busy hour (I went at 4 PM on a Friday), then have a chat with him about his life after he graduated college. Inspirational man and delicious sandwiches.
author: Mitty C.

description:
Challenging conventional wisdom that chicken apple sausage is proper only on a hot dog bun or in an omelet, the friendly ladies at the Sandwich Place dare put it between two slices of wheat bread. And then they add grilled onions. And veggies. And some condiments. And it makes me very happy.

Think different people. Enjoy.
author: Jason B.

description:
The sandwich place has officialy become that one place in SF that we MUST visit, whenever in SF. Not only because the sandwiches are just that amazing, but because when you eat here, it's like you become part of the family!

We were very fortunate to come across this tiny hole in the wall after we got off the 16th St. BART stop in the Mission. Upon entering this tiny shop, you are given the warmest greeting one can receive by the family, including the most lovely, sweetest abuelita ever. 

Not being able to decide which of the numerous amazing-sounding sandwiches to order, I requested they tell me what to order. We ended up with the milanesa sandwich and the special of the day, which was a roast turkey sandwich. "AYE, DIOS MIO!" is the only way to describe the deliciousness of these sandwiches. The milanesa was amazing and breaded perfectly, and topped with fresh ingredients. And the turkey was roasted in cranberries! I never wanted the sandwich to end, which actually took some time, despite the fact that it was the "small" roll. 

In addition to the amazing food and service, the abuelita continued to check up on us constantly, and even chatted it up with us as well. I'm still thinking about showing up just showing up with my suitcase and force myself into the family. 

In conclusion, don't waste your time eating a sandwich in the Mission at any other place than here. Otherwise, you're just stupid.
author: Gino E.

description: I don't get it. This must be one of those places that pays for a high Yelp listing, because both the coffee and sandwich were just average. Maybe it was over-hyped for me. The service was very friendly but ultimately, the food matters the most.
author: Chris B.

description:
Such a great find! A total hole in the wall, but amazing sandwiches and such nice people working there. I had the honey baked chicken sandwich, which comes with a yummy sun-dried tomato spread. H had the club, which he really liked. The best part was definitely the bread- fresh, soft, and flavorful! 

It's family owned, and the ladies who make the sandwiches are so sweet! I love family operations like this. I really appreciated how nice they were. We've all been to the places that are particular (or mean) about making substitutions, and as a picky sandwich eater, I HATE when I get attitude for making changes. This place was the opposite...they were so sweet and happy to add or remove things to make my sando perfect. 

The only negatives:
- no place to sit
- everything is made on the spot, so I think it can take a while sometimes. Our sandwiches came out quickly, but the in front of us had to wait a while.
author: L B.

description: The sandwich I got was really great--the pesto mayo is delicious and their wheat bread roll was tasty and fresh.  The ambiance was terrible though and even at non-peak time the service time was pretty long.  Also, I may have mis-understood the situation but the manager seemed to bark orders at the staff which some might find unsettling.
author: Maryanna Q.

description: Went here when I had a free Friday and a quest for a new sandwich place in SF.  Holy crap, the sandwich I had was AMAZING.  I'm mostly vegetarian and was happy to see a entire wall of 8 specialty veggie sandwiches, I ordered the South West and it was delicious.  It's kind of chaotic in there, the owner is a real character and there's a lot of shouting in spanish.  There's no place to sit inside, just a couple tables right outside but you're better off taking your sandwich to eat somewhere else.
author: Dan M.

description:
Was not in the mood for the usual heavy Mexican food lunch during my lunch hour in the Mission. I've passed this place plenty of times, and it usually has a line out the door so I decided to try it out.

I would've given them a four but the initial rudeness of the lady behind the counter lost it a star. At first I was a little put off by the lady behind the counter barking at me in Spanish. Yeah, I'm Mexican and don't speak a word of Spanish. Sue me. Once I told her I didn't speak Spanish she spoke in English and progressively became less rude.

I ordered a turkey breast sandwich with cheese on wheat bread. The first bite was surprisingly delicious, like really really good delicious.

I had a bite of my friend's oven roasted chicken breast hot sandwich, and WOW. So. damn. good!

So yeah, of course I'll be back. Rude service? Eh, everyone has their bad days. Right?
author: Vanessa F.

description:
I used to go often to this Sandwich place but since I saw the owner getting grumpier with time, I decided to reduce my visit to only some Saturdays that is when the owner Juan is not in. Don't get my wrong, I love the sandwiches from this place, the sandwiches are good! .. but the owner is just NOT friendly at times. In couple of occasions I haven't even gotten a 'Thank you' when I paid the owner despite telling him 'Thanks'. 

The girl who makes the sandwiches is very friendly and seems to have been there forever, her name is Lily and she is very friendly .. she should be running the business. 
Lily, retire the owner and take over the business and I could possibly stop by more often. The three stars are for Lily and the sandwiches ... not for Juan :(
author: Christine A.

description:
Chicken salad sandwich with everything on it. Jalapenos with chicken salad? Yes please! Can I have a slice of provolone too? Thanks!
Juan is hilarious and charming. So are the busy sandwich ladies. Come here on a sunny Saturday (but get there before close at 2pm!) and then hop over to Dolores park with your sammy.
author: L P.

description:
If you like crazy good sandwiches, you should like this place.  If you like crazy moon people, you should like eating outside this place.  If you like creative variety from vegan to carnivore, quality ingredients, and super cool service from a super cool owner, you should like this place.  

"My name's Juan" he told me- "but if you don't like the sandwich, it's Jose.  We've been here 23 years."  I liked the sandwich.  I live a block away and often end up at my standby burrito places out of laziness, and it's amazing that it took me almost 3 years to try one here.  I walk by often and have even been tempted by their menu in the window, but it's not open late and it's very easy to miss.  Seek this place out.

The only small drawback for me is that the prices are slightly higher for a slightly smaller portion than I usually get for a meal (filling but probably no leftovers for later- that's OK).  Juan explained to me that he chooses all of the ingredients carefully and creatively, for example, to make his veggie burgers in house (not frozen and pre-made.)  That's what you pay for.  He said he had to invent his own after being disappointed by bland veggie choices at other places, and if that's the best they could do he's guaranteed to do better.

Out of 6 or 8 very tempting veggie choices on the menu, I chose the Tree Hugger:  diced veggie burger sauteed with a bunch of other veggies, dressing and mixed greens.  It was good.  I may favor spicier choices in the future but I'm no less tempted to go back and try the others.
author: Pat L.

description: One of the best vegetarian sandwiches I have had. The Veggie Veggie on a freshly-made French Roll. The business owners are extremely appreciative of your business. Cash only. I will be back!
author: Ashley G.

description:
A hidden sandwich shop in the middle of burritoland.  I have walked by and missed this place several times, it's right near the BofA ATMs at 16th and Mission.  It wasn't until my bf found this place on yelp and we stalked it down using the old school street number method, that we finally found it..

The guy at the cash register was uber nice and made you feel right at home.  The actual store area is really small and hot, there are two tables outside, and if there aren't crazies sitting and harassing you, it could actually be nice.  

As usual, a weird half homeless but very much crazy man was at one of the tables.  He kept bugging me, so I stood up, lost my table, and had to eat at the 16th and mission bart stop.

Now onto the food.  BF got the Al Pacino- roast beef, hot peppers, tomato, yum. I got special fried sole with homemade tartar -yum too.

I wish they had more seating, but yummy sandwiches for the win.
author: Skye W.

description: I never get a chance to try lunch places in the Mission since I work in Union Square. Luckily when working from home recently I remembered The Sandwich Place. In the heart of the mission with no bike parking within the block. When I poked my head inside to check it out (to determine if it was going to be worth the hassle of leaving my bike somewhere) the super nice owner said bring it on inside! Even though it was tiny! Bonus points for that. I was a little overwhelmed with all the options but already knew I wanted - the hot pastrami. Don't be expecting super fast food here. There were only 2 other people when I was there but they had a bunch of phone orders that kept coming in. With only 2 people making sandwiches it took 10-15 min to get my sandwich. Luckily the owner is very gregarious and kept us entertained with conversation. The sandwich was super good too. At least as good as Ike's to give you a frame of reference. From that POV it's probably also faster service. I recommend this place for sure if you're in the neighborhood though I'm not sure it's worth traveling to (my same POV on Ike's btw). Unfortunately it's just a little too out of my way to be a regular.
author: Jean K.

description: Absolutely the best place for a gluten-free sandwich in San Francisco. All their sandwiches are great, but for those who are GF, this is a pretty special place!
author: Aaron A.

description:
A fantastic little sandwich shop with deceiving looks, atleast from the outside. I'm often in the area so discovering this somewhat hidden spot was a big deal, with affordable, delectable sandwiches and excellent staff. 

When I say somewhat hidden, I dont mean it's location. It's very centrally located at 16th and Mission, across from the BART station. I mean I've passed by the place so many times and never thought to try it out, it's a very plain, tiny place that isn't very inviting. But once I tried it I was hooked, like so many other yelpers.

Juan is a great guy, and if you are ever unsure what sandwich to try, he will pick a definite winner. All sandwiches are made right in front of you and made right, with decent (though I wish they used more) amounts of fresh ingredients and very tasty meats (the pastrami is sublime). Be sure to hit the ATM beforehand, as it's cash only.
author: Chris G.

description: Freakin' adorable staff.  There's something neat about old Latina grandmas using iPad apps to charge your credit card.  And of course they have an awesome assortment of sandwiches.  They have just as many veggie options as they do meat!  They make their own bread on-site too!
author: Heidy S.

description:
I have eaten at the Sandwich Place many times.  I really like the Mom and Pop's stores, rather than the chains.  I have eaten the "Bad Boy" (roast beef), combo, BBQ chicken, Tuna, Pastrami, and have always had an excellent filling sandwich.  Prices are very low for a fresh sandwich.  Every couple of weeks, the owner and his Mom made real roast turkey sandwiches.  

The owner is my homeboy, so he gets five stars.
author: Coyote B.

description: Went here after reading all the good yelp reviews about the gluten free bread they offer. Not only do they bake the bread fresh daily, but they don't even charge extra for gluten free which is basically unheard of in the GF world! They toast it to perfection, and its totally devoid of that hard, dry, crumbly texture that usually comes along with that type of product. Basically, it tastes like 'regular' homemade bread. The owner told me he had to perfect the recipe over time and he's definitely got it right. He also said he's working on some gluten free cookies which will be available shortly. So I can't leave out what I actually got on my sandwich: turkey, ham, cheese + all extra condiments (pickles, mayo, mustard, lettuce, tomato). Meat was quality, and a lot of it! Basically a good, straight up sandwich. I will definitely be going back.
author: S. V.

description:
It took me a while to find this place despite working right around the corner. This was largely due to the fact that my coworkers would rave about "Juan's", but never referring to it as "The Sandwich Place" 

Juan makes an amazing sandwich. I'm pretty picky, and he'll make it exactly how you like it... a fine quality in a man ;) 

The Sofie's Delight is my choice: portobello mushroom, basil, roasted bell pepper, onion, cheese, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and I'm not a huge fan of mayo, so Juan hooks it up with sundried tomato spread instead. 
mmmmm..
author: Marisa K.

description: I loooooove this place...just order the special of the day. Whatever it is.
author: JT T.

description: This is a great sandwich place in the Mission.  The sandwiches are each made using an oven , not a microwave and special orders are gladly accepted.  I usually order here about twice a week. Juan really treats his customers well.  It's a great bang for the buck and the quality is always excellent.  Be advised it's a take out place, so plan to take your food to go.  It takes about fifteen minutes to have your order made so call ahead.
author: S. G.

description: On the hunt for the perfect pastrami sandwich, I decided to tuck in here one morning and give 'em a try. Unfortunately, I'd just recently returned from NYC. That's like eating pizza in Peoria after returning from Naples. The pastrami is a favorite here, but I'm more of a fan of the guy who runs place, I think his name is Juan based on other Yelp reviews. He's a real character and certainly brightened up his customers' mornings. The sandwich was good, probably above-average for SF. But he wouldn't last a day in NYC.
author: Brett W.

description:
Juan (and his sandwich making ladies) make The Sandwich Place real. Their tuna melt is melt-in-your-mouth-fantastic! Their location is convenient - across from 16th Street BART. Their service is welcoming - Juan seems to know each and every customer that crosses his threshold. And they feature Italian/Mexican/American sandwich combinations - tastily exotic!

FYI, Give yourself 20 minutes during the lunch rush - this place is popular!
author: Amy P.

description: I stopped in for a sandwich and I wasn't sorry. The fake-meat was excellent and the bread was very tasty (the owner seemed very proud that he made the fake-meat himself and baked the bread in a brick oven - and he should be). Seems like a hidden gem & I'll definitely be back.
author: Emily M.

description: Juan bakes his own fresh GLUTEN FREE bread daily/frequently, which is 90% of the battle for finding a good sandwich shop for those of us that are wheat-challenged.  Ya can't fault a guy for being busy...but I've found that calling in the order for pickup cuts down on the semi-long wait (and ensures that he's not out of the GF).  Tasty eats with a nice guy bonus for Juan.
author: Jonathan J.

description: This place has the best gluten free bread I've ever had. I got the BLT with avocado and red pepper mayo and it's delicious and very reasonably priced. The owner is really friendly too. I'm so excited to have such a delicious gluten free option so close to work. LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: La W.

description: I had the turkey sandwich, and it was just okay.
