The turkey was obviously from Safeway or something (it tasted like it came out of a bag), and everything else really just tasted like something I could make out of my own fridge. Actually, my sandwich probably would have tasted better. I don't get why this place is so highly rated.
author: Michelle G.

description:
After all these years in SF (many of them living in the mission) i know i've walked past this place literally HUNDREDS of times. how...HOW is it possible that it was kept secret from me until today!?! i am generally not a huge sandwich fan. there is only so much you can do if you're a veggie between two pieces of bread. so when my friend (who is from Berkeley) suggested we go there this afternoon i hesitatingly said....ok. 

impressed by the wall of vegetarian options, i ordered the Sophie's choice on toasted wheat (i will now refer to as Isabel's choice) which consisted of portabella mushrooms, red peppers, some delish mayo, a prefect amount of munster cheese and some other stuff i can't remember. Let's just say it may have been the best freaking sandwich i have ever tasted (maybe only aside from panini in italy). Juan advised us to be brave and try them each on future visits. he told me he really takes pride in the veggie menu, which of course i totally appreciate. and they are very affordably priced to fit your fun-employment minded budgets! i know you won't be disappointed.
author: Isabel C.

description: I promised Juan a review, haha, this guy is great, and so is this place! Great selection (Vegetarian and carnivores alike), good service, and decent prices. I got the "Kitchen Sink"- awesome stuff for a meat and potatoes guy like myself. My girl's a vegetarian, so she went with the "Tree Hugger" with gluten-free bread- she loved it! All in all, I'd definitely repeat.
author: Noah A.

description: Greatness.  Super cool staff, no nonsense, and killer sandwiches.  The Hot Pastrami.  Do it, and your taste buds will thank thee.  Fight through the hordes of the undead surrounding 16th and Mission BART and get your sandwich on.
author: Sean H.

description: This is the best sandwich shop in sf. They never miss. I can't think of a better sandwich spot anywhere. Really really good.
author: Justin G.

description:
Food: Good
Atmosphere: Owner was funny, but put off by his loudness/cockiness at first 
Price: Fair/Poor
One Word: Eh.

Will I go back? Maybe. Not a ton of other sandwich places around 16th and Mission, right?
author: Art A.

description: Nom nom nom! Herbivore gone wild! Must have the veggie veggie.. It's one of the best sandwiches in the hood
author: Jacqueline b.

description: Best sandwich place in the area, and an authentic neighborhood vibe. Nice people, good music playing, bargain prices, great food.
author: Stuart M.

description: Juan promised me the best sandwich I've ever had and he delivered! My Sophie's Choice with added avocado has tied for best sandwich ever (the other winner is the Caprese Sandwich with Prosciutto from Lucca's in Marina). The service is excellent and very friend, and the food is incredible. This sandwich spot has been in the family for decades and you can tell they've really perfected it over the years. A+
author: Jillian T.

description:
They have a wide variety of interesting, tasty, and hearty veggie sandwiches - which makes them awesome in my book. Too often, I'm hungry 30 seconds after eating a vegetarian sandwich (Subway, anyone?) but these sandwiches keep me full for hours.

They are definitely on the less than healthy side - but their flavored mayos are too good to pass up! 

Not to mention, every time I go in there, the guy behind the counter is friendly, amusing, and nice to everyone. 

I wish they were open on the weekends, but it's probably better that they're not!
author: Liz S.

description:
I went into this place with one purpose - to try Sophie's Choice. I'm a true carnivore who loves her veggie sandwiches. I think it started years ago with my love affair with caprese sammies...

Even as I ordered the sandwich I was pretty skeptical. I've never liked portabella mushrooms and this is the main ingredient. Still I had to try it out after all the positive reviews this sandwich has received. Juan began describing to me just why this sandwich rocks - the way he marinates the mushrooms in olive oil, the crispy basil inside, the muenster. I could tell he really takes pride in this creation. 

Got home and took my first bite - wow! Juan was so right. Everything in the sandwich works beautifully together. I can't wait to go back and try everything else.
author: Foodie K.

description: Food was delicious and service was great. My biggest complaint was not being able to decide which sandwich to get. I ended up with the Al Pacino...excellent choice! We will definitely be going back.
author: Freedom H.

description:
SO friendly, SO pleasant, SO tasty, SO quick, and it was SO cheap! 
What a great little place! Delicious sandwiches.  Take it out to nearby Dolores park on a sunny day and enjoy!
author: Nilu r.

description: decently priced sandwiches in the mission. the owner is a hoot. He's always around and helping out and sounds frantic speaking rapidly in spanish. These sandwiches are a favorite lunch spot for my team. Love it!
author: Chayne J.

description:
yup, a great place for a sammie. i work right around the corner and frequent this spot for lunch. the honey-roasted chicken sandwich is bomb. and the guy that works there (hopefully soon i'll know his name and he'll know my regular order) is super friendly and cheery. 

grab a sammie and take it to dolores park? yes sir.
author: Georgia W.

description: I am so surprised.  They make their own GLUTEN FREE bread for the sandwiches.  They've got me as a fan forever!
author: Target T.

description: Juan was great. He told me a lot about his bread and why he uses yellow cheddar over white cheddar (it's less processed). Overall it was a great value and experience.
author: Amanda C.

description: A-Ok sandwich shop. I go here fairly often during my work lunch. The owner makes the best sandwiches out of everyone there. He made mine once and it was finally what I wanted it to be. If the sandwiches were as good as he makes them every time, this would be 4 star review. Unfortunately the generous amount of ingredients isn't consistent throughout the whole staff, but it's still decent. I've had the club sandwich a few times and I also tried their chili cheese dog (messy but good). They are cash only and close early (2 pm) on Saturdays, and aren't open at all on Sundays. This doesn't coincide with my work schedule unfortunately, but I'd be stoked to have such a schedule!
author: Katie S.

description: The best vegetarian sandwich I've had in San francisco. Even if you are not a vegetarian do try their southwestern. Delicious !
author: Revant K.

description:
The Sandwich Place gets 3.5 stars. The sandwich was really good at first - large, delicious, very filling - but as the day went on I felt thirstier and thirstier. Like ridiculously, not normal amounts of thirstiness. I ordered turkey, avocado, bacon, cheese, on a dutch crunch ... so maybe there was a lot of salt in the bacon, but I'm already on my 3rd Sigg water bottle refill. 

My sister ordered the tuna melt and said that it was just ok. 

I don't know if I'll come back yet. If I find myself in the Mission I might. The people working today were super super friendly!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Ok, so I have now eaten my way through their entire veggie section.....and WOW! I mean, when I eat these sammies I think being a vegetarian might not be so bad....well, then I remember my LOVE of bacon, but honestly, I love Sophie's Delight....
I plan on eating my way through the carnivorous selection, so stay tuned
author: Bianca L.

description:
I was meeting some people in Oakland and decided to pick up a sandwich on the way to BART. I got the sandwich of the week and it was pretty good. The people here are very friendly but the sandwiches are so complicated that they take a while for them to make. They were out of rolls and that's OK except that the sandwich they made for me was a little soggy and it soaked through the bread.
 
I'll give this place another try if I can ever figure out their hours. Seriously, why is a sandwich place open at 6:30 in the morning? If they opened at 8 am they'd still get people on their way to work and they could stay open till 6:30 in the evening instead of 5:00 and get some dinner business. The hours are bizarre.
author: Manny F.

description:
Their sandwiches are fairly basic, Subway-like in their bread roll and being able to view it being made behind the glass.  But their variety sets them apart.  There are more than a couple of veggie choices, and they feature different types of mayo to give it that extra kick.  In short, the sandwiches are extremely cheap, yet fresh and filling.  Their major shortcoming is in their limited hours.

You've passed by it many times, but you'd never even realized it was there.  Someone else hit the nail on the head--with such a varied menu, this place would undoubtedly blow up if they set up shop a block away on Valencia.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Thanks yelp!  Having worked in the area for years I was desperate to find a decent sammich.  And like other reviewers, I had passed by this place a thousand times without ever knowing it was there (which makes sense given its locaiton and small size).  Even when it appeared in a search I struggled to believe not just that it was good but that it was at the listed address.  It couldn't have been more than a month of disbelief and a bit of trepidation (seriously, do you know where this place is?) before I ventured in.  Even then, partly because I still didn't see it and also because of the scene on the street in front, I almost walked by.  But I am oh so glad I stopped in.

My sandwich was HUGE.  I basically never have any leftovers of anything but each half of this sandwich was a lunch.  Plus with it being a small place and the sandwich being made right in front of me, I was able to control the quantity of each topping which was nice.  And, as people have said, the owner and staff were very friendly.  In terms of quality, everything seemed fresh and it all tasted good.  I will definitely return!
author: Jay W.

description:
Nice little, cheap eats place with an owner who goes the extra mile for good service.
Location convenient to transit, but waay too many unsavory characters laying in the surrounding landscape.
That's ok cuz it helps keep the prices down, just wear your cow field wading boots...

keys lunch cheapeats breakfast
author: G K.

description:
Any owner of a place that constantly calls his clients "flaco" (or "flaca") becomes a favorite of mine.

I had the chicken milanesa sandwich (A chicken schnitzel). It was flavorful and juicy. It was also the first time I had not asked to take anything off standard add-ons. The add-ons perfectly complimented the milanesa.

The sandwich was large and filling. The place itself is small, and the owner has its own system of attending to clients, so let him do the organization, and you won't regret it.
author: Ron B.

description:
The Sandwich Place is your friend. 

I've been fed by Juan, his wife, and co-workers for over 2 long years now.
I  can't stress enough how good this place really is.
First off, they have weekly specials that make my nipples hard. Beware! Specially that Al Paccino sub. Their very own Italian oven roast beef with pepperoncini, melted Provolone cheese, fresh greens, balsamic vinegar and E.V.O.O. Sexyness all over your face.
Also, one of the only places where I can appease my Argentinean hunger for a MILANESA sandwich. They dish out both chicken and steak. 
Do your digestive system a favor and try one.

In all seriousness, this place can do no evil. Salads, sandwiches, and some of the best fair-trade coffee u'll wake up to. They aced it all. Their soups are amazing too (I'm lookin' at you, split pea). oh! Mission vegetarian hipsters will find enough variety in the selection to keep them interested.   

Fawk. I'm gettin' hungry already. 


only complaint would be (if anything at all) their operating hours. They close at 5 pm. Boohoohoo!
author: Tomas V.

description:
this place is such a gem. Today I was getting ready for a surprise birthday fishing expedition and we wanted deli sandwiches so bad, so I yelped deli near my house, and I found this place. So i walked over to get sandwiches and was immediately greeted and asked for my order. The women behind the counter was so sweet! I told her about all her good yelp reviews and she introduced me to her family there, her mom and her brother, and tlod me that they had been a mom and pop since 1978!!!!!!!!

I support independent places like this in general, but they totally made a lifer out of me. Everyone was so very sweet, and while I was waiting for my sandwiches to come out the old women behind the counter gave me a cookie in a napkin. On the way out they all blew kisses and said "nice to meet you"

These ladies are truly inspiring! I wish there were more people in the world that were as truly gracious as these women. They made my day, and btw the sandwich was outstanding.
author: Micah R.

description:
If you opt for the breakfast sandwich with egg and cheese, be sure to also opt for the sun-dried tomato mayo and jalapenos. You won't shit 'til dinner, but you won't want to eat 'til dinner either, so it's pretty much a tradeoff. As an added bonus, you'll also be able to hear your arteries hardening.
Call ahead. Just do it.

Update 11/07/06: I fricking love the owner. Seriously. He's so darn great, like the uncle who'd send you $50 for your birthday when everyone else sent you $20! I think his name is Oscar, but he's never a grouch.

Update 3/27/07: Um, his name is Juan. And all orders over $20 include free delivery!
author: Alyssa R.

description:
Extremely friendly staff, cramped but clean environment AWESOME sandwiches, i love how they use micro greens instead of empty calorie and water lettuce .

I recommend the Al Pachino Special
author: Tien N.

description: I love this sandwich shop to death! They have the best customer service and they make their own bread! They even make a gluten free bread! YUMMAY!
author: karyn h.

description:
A peculiar establishment, this is. How can a delicious steak sandwich be found in the rectum of the Mission District? A mystery to be sure.

Read closely: parking is challenging so either take a bus/BART, or do a drive by with a buddy. Bring cash. During lunch it can get busy, so you can call ahead for convenience. Some delicious sandwiches here. Some days have certain special sandwiches.

And now the fine print. In layman's terms, the neighborhood is teaming with disease, germs, drugs, and crime. Please don't stay in this area long (unless you are sufficiently armed) and don't bring children. "Rustic diehards" will flame me but I know some inside info on the area and have been familiar with the area since the early 80's----and it's not getting better.

Now to the food. When you enter and see a hispanic, over-friendly, metrosexual-like male who talks a lot, I will allow him to take my order, BUT not to make my food. He has a penchant for using his hands on the phone, the cash and cash register, and then directly onto the food----without washing. In this neighborhood of questionable hygiene, how can a food server act in such a manner? This goes beyond "ignorance is bliss". Me, I'd rather not take the chance. Order from one of the friendly ladies.

I recommend the Al Pachino and the steak sandwich (ask for the jalapenos and/or peppercini on this one). You've been warned.
author: Danny H.

description: great place in a cutty spot. Ive passed it for years and have never thought of going in because its in the shittiest part of 16 and mission Mcdonlads bank of america section. The owner could be your best friend. Best deal in the city. turkey, bacon and avacodo for $5.85. dirty chips and Vitamin water. Fresh baked bread. Toasted and great service. Go support.
author: Richard J.

description:
Yum, I say...Yum!!!

I had a short gig up in the city right near the BART station. I walked past this place for 4 days making note of the constant traffic that came in and out of this spot. 

Based on the good vibe I got when I walked by and staff recommendations I thought I would grab a sandwich. 

The Reuben sandwich is one of may favorite meat packs and it is very possible to screw this one up.

Lemme tell ya' it was a warm buttery more than enough meat GOOD! I couldn't eat the entire sandwich in one sitting and sadly placed the leftovers in the fridge. I know - risky and kinda gross for some folks, but I don't like to waste good food. It held up! Yah! Pastrami is great...I'll try the Sophia's delight soon.

The menu has a great selection and includes some love for the strictly veggie folks. Haven't tried these yet.

The guy behind the counter, who I assume is the owner was funny as hell. He mixed it up with some Spanish, English and Spanglish, chatted with the regulars, and cooed at the baby. He's connected to the community, which I love. It was all good. Tiny space, I think there was only two tables available to sit down at. 

This warrants a special BART trip to SF for sandwiches for sure. Hmmmm...maybe today!
author: Livingwell B.

description: This place is so amazing! It looks totally sketchy from the outside but the sandwiches here are incredible! My mom was in town and we were feeling peckish on our way to the bart station. We decided to split a half chicken sandwich, which was the perfect amount of food for the two of us--the sandwiches are huge! The owner was so friendly and helpful. He told us all about how he makes everything there from scratch--all the sauces, honey baked chicken, pesto, meats, etc. The only bad thing about this place is that they close super early, i think at 6pm, so I can't go there nearly as often as I wish i could.
author: heather i.

description: I've been eating here since I was a little girl, I remember walking home from school begging for a sandwich rather than McDonald's ;) this place is awesome, it's family owned so all the people are super friendly.  You'll get to know everyone well after just a few visits.  The sandwiches are huge and always fill you up, I would recommend a pastrami sandwich, they have the best pastrami in town, but ask them to drain it more so your sandwich doesn't get soggy.  I think a lot of people miss out because it looks like a whole in the wall near a fruit store and old peoples home, but they're missing out.  If you're ever in the Mission you got to stop by and grab a sandwich!
author: Christina O.

description:
I'd give them 5 stars, but their hours are tight on the weekends, which is when I would go there the most. The guy who runs the place is super cool, as are most of the folks that work there. 

Great quality sandwiches that are huge and really, really tasty. Interesting specials too, like shredded italian beef with provolone and sundried tomato mayo, salad greens, etc. And they're breakfast sandwiches are insanely good, but super rich. 

The ingredients they use really sets them apart, even if it's on one of the crappiest blocks in the Mission. If they moved their digs even one block to Valencia, their business would explode - it's that good. In the meantime, a quick stop off the 16th BART and they're right across the street.
author: Jay N.

description:
Mmm tasty! I got the basic veggie sandwich (1st one on the wall) and it was really good! Good whole-wheat-ish bread, fresh fillings and flavor. Yum! I will definitely go back - it's nice to have a local version of Subway.  :) BTW, this sandwich wasn't greasy at all and tasted very fresh and healthy (avocado, the good fat). 

This has probably been mentioned, but since I missed it - there are no tables inside and there are 2 small tables outside. Since I am always cold, this doesn't help me. Take a seat and catch the 16th & Mission action!
author: Shal J.

description:
A rare true San Francisco hidden gem!  I probably walked past this place 100 times before I read about it on yelp and decided to check it out.  I was immediately struck by the surprising number of vegetarian options for a hole-in-the-wall looking place, and the ingredients are very high quality, except as someone else mentioned, the bread is not exceptional.  The people who work there are really friendly, and recognized me on my second visit.  The big drawback is that there's no seating, which isn't a problem for me because I live two blocks away, but I guess picnicking on the BART plaza probably isn't most people's idea of a good time.

It's about the same price as a burrito, but won't leave you with that feeling of having swallowed a brick.
author: Jen W.

description:
Sophie's Delight made me dance it was so good.

P.S. Here it is! http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&hl=en&geocode=&q=16th+street+and+mission+street,+san+francisco&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=42.901912,77.871094&ie=UTF8&ll=37.767933,-122.419646&spn=0.0105,0.019011&z=16&om=1&layer=c&cbll=37.764138,-122.419575&cbp=1,97.5231266328373,0.569381598878681,2
author: erika l.

description: I love this place, and have been going here for quite a few years.  DEFINITELY my favorite sandwich shop in the Mission (yes, even better than the legendary Mr. Pickles).  I've never had anything here that I disliked.  Juan is a great guy, and is always friendly, despite how rushed and busy the place can be at times.  The only complaint is that sometimes, a couple of the ladies making the sandwich get busy and forget the instructions I gave them about my sandwich (ie. no onions).  Other than that, the perfect little shop
author: Ron C.

description: 4 Stars.  Good place for a cheap sandwich.  Crowd is typical Mission/16th, so you may get free entertainment while you're there.  Owner is loud but that only adds to the entertainment factor.  I'm glad it's only take out. :)
author: Kevin M.

description:
I come here 1-2 times a week because I work in the Mission.   I LOVE everything about this place--the tasty ingredients, the prices, the Dirty's potato chips, the guy behind the counter...(call me)

The clincher for me is the array of flavored mayos:  sundried tomato, chipotle, pesto, garlic, aoli, whatever.  If it's a fatty sauce-- I want it.

As of this week they have a new sandwich.  I tried it, loved it (of course)...the Southwestern Veggie Burger.  I told my man behind the counter that if I liked it I would spread the word; when you make sandwiches like that, your wish is my command.
author: anna D.

description: They bake their own gluten free bread every day!!  So good!!
author: The Breakfast-Lunch Club o.

description:
This place will hit the spot if you want a sandwich that is salty and greasy..  i don't know if it's just me, but sandwiches like that feel like comfort food.

but don't go here if you want sandwiches that taste fresh, and not oily.  if you want a clean fresh sandwich in the mission, go to guerrero market instead. (http://www.yelp.com/biz/cd6UzEmq4KFAepApE5AAAA)
author: Jung L.

description:
Another place i have been coming to for more than 10 years!!!  The service is friendly and fast, the portions healthy and the sandwiches SUPERB!!!  i would say this is the best sandwich shop in SF.

it inspires me to open one of my own!

my fav is the roasted eggplant!  YUMMMMMMM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: the one m.

description: Hot pastrami sandwich ftw!  You get a plentiful portion of pastrami glazed with onions, lettuce, tomatoes, mayo and mustard.  Fyi, the giant size is enough to feed two people.  I tried the gumbo and wasn't enthused.  Just get the hot pastrami, lol. Also, Juan, the owner (I think?), is nice and likes to chat.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Harry T.

description: i honestly thought that the good reviews on this place were some sort of weird viral marketing plant, until i went a few times.  juan is always a real blast to talk to, and the ingredients are always amazingly fresh & delicious.  i can't make any recommendations on the food because, honestly, it's all been fantastic.  did i mention the prices are great?  especially when you consider that a full sandwich will feed you for at least two meals.  plenty of vegetarian options and gluten-free bread (which doesn't taste like cardboard) is available.
author: maria f.

description:
07/03/08 (Thursday):

I returned here for lunch today because I had to run an errand.

This time I ordered the "Al Pacino."  This was good and much better than their pastrami sandwich from before.

It was on a french roll with hot roast beef and assorted greens.  I really liked the fact that they didn't just use lettuce, but various greens because it made it tastier.  It also included jalapenos and onions.  I think I still have heartburn from the jalapenos.

Again, the "guy with the glasses" was there and just as friendly as from before.  I forgot to mention the grandma from last time, but she was also there handling the cash register.  The grandma was really nice also.  I had trouble holding my wallet, sandwich and soda before I left, but she told me to take a second to put my wallet in my pocket before I left.  Always a nice touch when you can tell the owners care about their customer's well-being.

Try the "Al Pacino" if you're looking for a tasty, hot roast beef sandwich.
author: Ben W.

description:
i love deli sandwiches...i've been a loyal customer for about 13 years/half my life...(haha, i sound old). 

i used to come here about once a week to get my lunner (lunch/dinner) before i went to work. i probably ate everything on the menu at least once. also, they have the BEST cookies! i loveeee their cookies...makes me want one right now thinking about it. 

i rarely come here now, since i don't work in the mission anymore...but when i am around the mission, i make it a point to stop by. the owner still recognizes me (now that's good customer service).
author: nancy b.

description: What you want in a sandwich spot! Some quick wit and attitude to wake you up before you head back to work!
author: Phil M.

description:
Avocado bacon, toasted, is the Best! Specials are often awesome, too.

The owner is really funny.

"Get a card, dude!" - buy 9 get 1 free - don't forget it.
author: Alexander S.

description:
I like this sandwich shop and have been going there a few years.  I've seen what happens to small businesses in this neighborhood, and I don't think people appreciate how good they had it until a place closes. 
 They have a guy bake their bread fresh daily and use organic vegetables in their sandwiches.  It's true not every sandwich they make turns out exactly the same depending on who makes it, but that's for factory assembly lines and fast food.  
It's the kind of place where if you go there every so often, they remember you, and what kind of sandwich you like.  There's just not that many old school sandwich places around anymore and this place specializes in that and does it well.  Their hot dogs are pretty good too.  We're lucky to have this place in the Mission still.
author: Stephnie K.

description:
What's not to love? Delicious and cheap sandwiches (the best steak sandwich I've had in I don't know how long), and a really sweet lady behind the counter making me feel welcome. This is my new lunch place.

I haven't tried them, but there are lots of veggie options which even sound good to this omnivore. Also a nice drink selection, and dirty chips too.

It's right at 16th & Mission so it's surrounded by nothing but the finest crazy crackheads the Mission has to offer. But don't listen to the whiners - this places closes at like 5pm, earlier on Saturdays, if you can't handle Mission st at noon that's just sad.
author: Gordon B.

description: great value, friendly staff (especially the owner), and most importantly...AMAZING SANDWICHES! you can't go wrong here.
author: Sofia M.

description:
I LOVE sammies, what I love more are good sammies....

This place has some really tasty ones. It's a super small place, but man do they make a mean sub. Minus a star for them being cash only, who carries cash now a days??!?
author: S A.

description: Oooh delicious. Real divey sandwich shop but the food is great. My friend ordered a pastrami sandwich on light rye... he was afraid he'd get a smaller sandwich (since that is a more petite bread choice) but the owner stacked the sandwich 3 slices of bread high! My friend loved it!  I got a Sophie's Delight. It was bomb. Next time I will hold off on the red peppers though....
author: Natasha P.

description: It is important to let people know when they do good buisness, and that is why I am giving this place 5 stars. Best sandwich around, with the best customer service and cheapest prices. Juan is the bomb! and I have nothing more to say (except that the sandwich place is the be all and end all for sandwiches in SF, or damn near anywhere else for that matter)! ! !
author: Zizzle f.

description: Every time I get a sandwich anywhere else, I wish I'd just gone with a Sophie's Delight.  I don't know how they make it so good, but it really, really is.  LOVE this place.
author: Sarah B.

description:
This place always had that "I'll eat it if you eat it, first" idea attached to it for me. Total hole in the wall, nondescript awning, seedy surroundings - qualities that, especially in the Mission, (as I should really know by now, having grown up in the area) generally point to tasty food.

So, someone wanted a sandwich and was due for a break. We keep menus in a file so that we can order ahead of time, sparing our wee 30 minute window from waiting with hunger pains. The Sandwich Place menu found itself on the counter and we were all pretty shocked to see the broad span of options. You've got your standard salami and american cheese mixed in with the homemade veggie burgers that are commonplace on Valencia, but less frequent one block east. 

We ordered five sandwiches and because it was One of Those Days, I volunteered myself to Get the Hell Out of There for a few to enjoy the fresh (debatable) air and steal a few bites from each one to allow the Yelp readers a fair and balanced review (not because I was hungry, or dishonest, or taking more than my fair share, or just honestly curious, or impatient, or indecisive). 

The "inside" of this place hailing sandwiches (that apparently has decent soup, too!) is consistent with the outside - no frills, just some counter space, and a clear view of ingredients being piled on top of one another, heated, sliced, etc. When hangry (hungry+angry), I can become a bit demanding and the plexiglass (I hope the guy that installed all of the bullet-proof glass has a monopoly on Mission St. because he either is already, or ought to be making a killing) can present problems with my temper as I squeal out to the poor guy making a sandwich that could be mine (but 9 times out of 10 isn't) that "I DON'T WANT MAYO!!!! JUST MUSTARD!!!! EXTRA ONIONS!!!" Generally, I retract back to my corner upon hearing that this sandwich is for someone ELSE (who is not as controlling and obnoxious, I'm sure) and that, YES, my order is being prepared as specified in the phone order and will be ready shortly. 

The guy that works the counter (owner? manager? just all-around nice guy?) is amusing and always has something to say, and never ceases to make me chuckle my plummeting-insulin laugh.  

The sandwiches are huge and inexpensive, always tasty, and remind me of my school days spent living off of Cala sandwich meal-deals. Part of their beauty is that they aren't the sandwiches Frjtz is serving (which is not a negative for either business, I love me some Frjtz, too!) , but certainly leaps and bounds above what one might find in the refrigerated section of Walgreens. 

Sandwiches are such a no-brainer when one thinks of quick "American" food, but fewer places than I would have anticipated actually deliver a simple, enormous, cheap tower of stuff between slices. Extra points go to the diverse menu that can feed our entire store, each person with a favorite, but eager to try everything else on the menu.
author: haley d.

description: This place is great. I worked in the mission and come here often for their MANY vegetarian options. I recommend Sophie's Delight and the Treehugger. I'm not a huge fan of mushrooms and thought Sophie's delight would be a huge portobello mushroom sandwich, but turned out to be cut slices of mushrooms with delicious basil mixed in. Yummmyyyyy.
author: Vivian W.

description: yum. went there once, im never in that area tho. but id go back definitely if i am around there.. the area is so ghetto. homeless people hollering at you while you eat outside the store.
author: Cindy L.

description: If you're on 16th can find this place on your first try....Way to go. The owner/sandwich maker is a true host. He will make suggestions and engage in friendly banter. Its hard to find a quality deli/ non-ethinic food place in the Mission so this place certainly stands out. There are a few tables so if the sun is out and the homeless aren't, you can enjoy anice lunch outside. Call in your order if you're dining around lunch time cause this place gets crowded.
author: Joe G.

description:
introduced by a friend, this place is pretty damn good at decent prices. the service is great and the sandwiches are great. i had the pastrami, but i wish i had tried the sandwich of the week--it was some kind of bread with dun dried tomatoes, slices of hame, melted jack cheese and whatever.
and get a giant. it's pretty fucking big.
would definitely go here again!
author: Kenneth H.

description: Hey, tasty sandwiches! The owner is really nice and warm. My friend and I split the fried fish special.. wa wa we wa. Fried fish, orange mango mayo, pimentos, and other delicious ingredients all stuffed between some nice crunchy bread. Prices are very reasonable - this sandwich was $6. I saw they had a grilled eggplant sandwich for only $4.25 I think. I shall return!
author: O K.

description: OK, first time here, he sells my sandwich to someone else...many apologies later he promises to make me happy. I ask for avo and am charged an extra buck. So, $8 sandwich, yummy but nothing extraordinary, no love for making me wait...not sure I'll be back.
author: Leslie C.

description: This place is pretty good.  I find it hard to believe that I haven't found more good sub shops in San Francisco.  Here you can get a pretty good size sandwich for cheap.  A small sandwich here fills me up which is rare.  The bread is pretty good, and I have found thats usually the deal breaker when it comes to sandwiches.  I just wish that they had places to eat inside.  They put chairs and a table outside but who wants to sit outside in that area of town.  Actually who wants to be in that area of town.  If this place was one block over on Valencia and it had places to sit and eat I would love it.  But I have to say its the best simple sub shop I have found in San Fran so far.  If any of you have ever eaten at Submarina, it reminds me of that.
author: ken c.

description:
very impressive.

i tried the pastrami at the recommendation of both of the delightful women behind the counter at this hole in the wall. the new yorker in me  screamed "get something else, this place isnt italian or jewish," but that guys an asshole, so i didnt listen to him.

all told, it was pretty solid. the pastrami was all right, and the price was reasonable considering that the portion, especially the meat, was massive. the bread was good too...lightly toasted might be even better.

whatever you call it...sandwich, hero, sub, grinder, hoagie, sando, sammie...this city generally comes up short. ive long said that san francisco, while one of the best food cities, underdelivers on simple foods like pizza, wings, and sandwiches. this is the first sando spot ive tried in san francisco where ive been completely satisfied. ive only been once, though, and i also have yet to try ikes, so i cant in good conscience hand out 5 stars...yet.
author: Jon W.

description: The sandwiches are good and cheap, but so are so many Mission sammies. You come to The Sandwich Place for the wisecracking manager.
author: Nick D.

description:
This is the best sandwitch shop in San Francisco!

Huge veggie and meat selections.  
And fresh avocado!
author: Karen L.

description: I went to the Cosmetology school a couple of building away from this place and i always noticed it was busy. So one day for lunch i went in and bump into this funny guy his name was Juan! and boy can he make you laugh! i then ordered a Juan Mariachi sandwhich which is a chicken sandwhich with the mixture of a fajita? any who it turned out to be my FAVORITE!! YOu should come over and see juan! He makes the best ICE COFFEES too! tell him Silvia says Hi!
author: Silvia C.

description: A little greasy, but great sandwiches for a great price!  Real friendly owner as well... and no sales tax.  Don't come expecting a healthy meal tho - my Reuben was deliciously fatty.  But you weren't wanting that after a crazy Halloween night, were you???
author: Tommy O.

description: Juan and his mom are the BOMB!! He is creative inventive and makes fabulous homstly mayonaises like cranberry, pesto and sundried tomato....their Godzilla Special ROCKS!!!  It's an oven roasted teriyaki chicken sandwich with fresh mixed greens, its out of this world! AND homebaked bread!!!!! WOO HOO!!!!!!!!!!!  I would only order the fresh meats here, I hate deli cut meat.  Plus where else can you go and be treated like a QUEEN!!!???  Run there.....Also on Saturday mornings, Juans mom prepares Gallo Pinto with Egg breakfast, ok Latinos, you reading this?????????  Go early they close around 3pm!
author: Bahvee V.

description: Sophie's Delight is really a delight, winning over a carnivore like me. The potato salad is straightforward, yet still pretty delicious.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Yet another reason I miss living in the Mission:  I am in lurv with this sandwich I got from the Sandwich Place today.  It's Sophie's Delight, a vegetarian sandwich with portabello mushrooms, basil, and some other stuff.  Usually I'm a lazy carnivore, but this is ridiculously good.  Plus the place is easy to get to and the people are nice and jokey.  It doen't cost much, which does my wallet some good. So, yeah... I like it.
author: Pirate M.

description: I wrote my last review of this 'place' just about one year and a month ago. The Sandwich Place gets a couple extra stars from me now. It is one of the best pastrami sandwiches I've had in this city. I think what did it for me today was the soft  bread it was on, it completely made the sammie. Well, the pastrami was pretty freaking good, too.  And I ordered everything on it, which I don't normally do with the mustard and pepper contingent, but hot damn, what a great sandwich. This is definitely The Place to be. So good.
author: Michael E.

description:
Who says flattery won't get you anywhere!!!  Juan G. was behind the counter when I first walked in on Monday (the day before actually placing an order) so that I could double check their hours, confirm the prices on their sandwiches and also make sure they accepted credit cards before I placed a slightly large order for a work meeting.  Juan was super nice, answered all my q's and told me it's cash only but that they do take company checks.  I wasn't sure if it would be a problem or not, but I conveyed to Juan that we couldn't issue a check until the following week, would this be alright?  He didn't even blink an eye.  He was like "Don't worry honey, we'll take care of you.  That's ok."  So our meeting was on Tuesday, I went in the following morning to place the order, and a sweet older women, who I think was the owner, was in and spoke to me in such a sugary way, that I genuinely felt like she was someone's cool grandma that you just wanted to hang out with.  When Juan walked in he threw in some adjectives to make any girl blush, and once I again the smile on my face was ear to ear.

So if you can't tell, saying that service rocks here, is an understatement.

As for the food, I had the Vivi's Veggie burger and inhaled two regular sized rolls in not a whole lot of time.  The rest of the people at our meeting seemed to be equally satisfied w/the B.L.T, Supreme and Club sandwiches b/c usually at the end of the night, we have leftovers.  This time there wasn't even a crumb to be seen...

I'm really looking forward to going back to the Sandwich Place and next time trying "Sophie's Delight" and the "Bonzai Burger," both look very appealing.  

and p.s.
They labeled everything like we asked and were totally ready for us when we showed up at the time we specified.  This has not happened anywhere else in the Mission where we've had to pick up food orders for work (which are generally bigger than your average take out & more time consuming).
author: Swetha G.

description:
i was super excited when i started temping in the mission because of all the great food options in the area. one day for lunch, i decided to do a blanket search for "take-out" and "$" to see what i would find. the sandwich place popped up, and i wasn't at all disappointed with the results. 

i ordered a steak milanesa (grilled steak with chipotle mayonnaise). it was fantastic. the bread was soft and crispy. the steak was tender and flavorful. the best part is that the chipotle mayonnaise (spicy) is actually melted into the middle of the bread. so you don't actually begin to taste the sweetness of it until you have started chewing. 

my order took a bit long (it's a hot sandwich), but i have no complaints. great, hearty sandwich for $7. yes, please.
author: Maveric V.

description:
What a surprise I received today when I followed a friend into The Sandwich Place for lunch today.  Great veggie options, I had the Tree Hugger sandwich, it was superb.   Quality ingredients and so much of the stuff is homemade, which makes it all the better, you can taste it.  Incredibly friendly staff who were so nice, chatty and full of jokes.

I will definitely come back here frequently.
author: Chris D.

description: I work 5 blocks away from this litte sandwich shop.  I always walk by this place and decided to give it a try.  I love sandwichs and the bread is the one of the most important part of a sandwich.  This place makes its own bread and has a large variety of sandwichs to choose from.  The staff are super friendly and the prices are very reasonable.  I have always ordered their Bacon and Avacado sandwich on their toasted bread.  All I have to say is umm..  ummm... ummmm....
author: Kuan Y.

description: ummmm HEAVEN!!! there is nothing bad i can say about this place except perhaps that the wait can be long - but thats because if you go at lunch everyone else is craving these sandwiches as well and is there waiting for them too. every sandwich i've had is delicious, also huge and so inexpensive. the owner is a lovely gentleman who i worship because of his glorious sandwich creations. my mouth is watering even writing this review. sigh.
author: Sabrina M.

description: I just had the best sandwich of my life. If you want to exponentially improve the goodness of your sandwich, have them grill it.
author: Alex E.

description:
I went to this place today for lunch after reading all the wonderful reviews from fellow yelpers. I ordered the 'Sophie's choice' as many yelpers had recommended it and I must say it was just delicious. The bread was well toasted and the smell of fresh basil was awesome. there was some kinda mayo/sauce that made the sandwich moist and tasty.
It is a tiny hole in the wall kinda place but the people are friendly and nice. I cant wait to go back there again and try their other sandwiches.
author: preethi m.

description:
After hearing a certain someone in my life rant and rave about this place, I finally resolved to check this place out. A quick BART ride from downtown and a really short walk from the station later, I was ready to put in my order. I went with their crab salad sandwich, which reminded me very much of Subway's old seafood and crab, but was actually good! I think the real winner there is the bread, not chewy dry, or flavorless. 

Prices are really good at this little sandwich shop, and the selections are plenty. The place is literally a counter, so don't expect eating at the shop.
author: Jared R.

description: crack.com... i had a ruben today.. and it was amazing. 8 bucks for a reg sammy and a drink. not bad. but that sammy is not going to fill you up if your starving.  this place is so good im coming back tomorrow.. seriously...
author: Ricky Y.

description: This place came highly recommended, and It just was not that great. The bread was falling apart and the pastrami was really fatty. There are much better sandwich places.
author: Adrienne G.

description: Absolutely the best place to get a sammy, period. They make every ingredient there including the mayonnaise. And Juan, the owner, loves messing around with the customers. Just go for the sandwich of the week and be done with it. Get your food to go though, because there's not really good seating. This is the first place I ate at when I moved to SF and if I ever left, it would be my last!
author: Jonathan S.

description: Known at my work as "Juan's". Really good. They make different types of sandwiches but I love their Mexican torta style sandwiches using regular french rolls. I order the turkey, bacon, avocado. They throw in jalapeno and Mexican cheese. So good and they are so nice!
author: julie q.

description:
I have trouble writing about this place since it's so incredible and I want it to remain my secret.  But they deserve the business, and the location will keep this place from getting too overrun.

GET THE SPECIALS!  The Tootsies special is the best sandwich in the city.  Fresh roasted turkey, cranberries, mixed greens (not crappy iceburge lettuce).   The roast beef specials are a close second.  All of the specials have freshly prepared meats instead of cold cuts that easily make getting a sandwich a highlight of any day.
author: Alec S.

description: I am so glad this little sandwich shop exists. I eat here regularly. The sandwich guy is a vivacious character. I am already a regular after eating here at least once a week. They have great vegetarian selections and I intend to try each variety.  I cannot speak for the meaty sandwiches this place offers as I will never have one, but there are always people lined up to get a sandwich from these people so you know it's gotta be good if people keep coming back it!This place is so much better than the cockroach infested greasy sandwich shop I stumbled into one day on Valencia.
author: Monica R.

description: If you want a sandwich in the Mission this is where you need to be.  Amazing service and they have a great selection of veggie sandwiches.  Make sure to put your tips in the alien head.
author: Benzo K.

description: Cheap, decent sandwiches, fresh ingredients, wide variety, but shoddy service.  I waited much longer than I expected, even for a simple sandwich shop like this.  The staff seemed distracted.  And despite requesting "no onions" and the woman verbally repeating "no onions", she still put onions in my sandwich.
author: Michael M.

description: This is the only place I've found with good, basic, deli sandwiches in The Mission. The sandwiches are above par and the staff is super friendly. The owner is one of the nicest guys you'll meet.
author: Brian B.

description: Amazing sandwiches.  Great diversity of veggie food!  Everything I look for in a sandwich: Tasty, cheap, fresh, and innovative (although they do great classics too!)
author: Daniel Y.

description: I heard about this place from a friend, and it was seriously good.  My sandwich had ground turkey with all these herbs mixed in and grilled onions and mushrooms.  Also, Juan is one of the nicest people in the world.  Check it out.
author: Elissa C.

description: I have good memories of this place.  I used to come here as a kid and order sandwiches for fieldtrips.  I recently decided to take my daughter there.  I had the vegetarian sandwich with pesto mayo.  It was really good.  My daughter had a salami sandwich and she loved it.  I will continue to support this great sandwich place!
author: Jackie R.

description: Great sandwiches, tasty bread not too hard not too soft with a nice crunch, the fish special was most excellent. Juan is really a great host. Go eat here. One warning however you may not want to eat at any other sandwich place ever again. it is THAT good.
author: davey w.

description: first of all this place's food is awesome! all the ingredients are fresh and the bread is so good.( they get it baked fresh daily).  they would have gotten more stars but there customer service sucks!! everytime i have been in there the older lady behind the counter is so rude. but i have continued going there because the sandwiches are so good i just suck it up and deal with her rude ass! she is  a snobby, bitter old lady that really needs to work on her customer service skills. is it because i'm hispanic but don't speak spanish? who knows but as of today i give up on this place. i went in there and when it was my turn to order she asked what i wanted. i guess the 3 seconds it took me to get my words out  was too long for her because she immediately said "next" and looked at the next customer.i just walked out. i'm just fed up with her rudeness! i am always nothing but polite to her despite her rudeness. kill em with kindness. the owner juan is a great guy and the food is terrific but after today i will never go to the sandwich place again. i'm done dealing with her bitter ass.from now on  i will buy my sandwiches elsewhere!
author: SEN M.
